sentence: Southwestern and southern Colorado are a complex mixture of desert and mountainous regions.

name: colorado
sentence: The climate of the eastern plains is semi-arid (Köppen climate classification: BSk) with low humidity and moderate precipitation, usually 15-25 inches (380-640 millimetres) per year.

name: colorado
sentence: The area is known for its abundant sun and cool and bright nights, which give this area a large range of average daytime temperature.

name: colorado
sentence: The difference between the highs of the days and the lows of the nights can be considerable, because the heat dissipates in the space during the clear nights, since the thermal radiation is not trapped by the clouds.

name: colorado
sentence: The Front Range urban corridor, home to most of Colorado's population, is in a severe precipitation shadow because it is on the lee side of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In summer, this area can have many days above 95°F (35°C) and often 100°F (38°C).

name: colorado
sentence: In the plains, winter lows typically range from 25 to 10°F (−4 to -23°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 75% of precipitation occurs during the growing season, from April to September, but this area is highly drought-prone.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of the precipitation comes from thunderstorms, which can be severe, and major snowstorms that occur in winter and early spring.

name: colorado
sentence: If not, winters tend to be generally dry and cold.

name: colorado
sentence: In much of the area, Mars is the most snowy month.

name: colorado
sentence: The months of April and May are normally the wettest, while April is the wettest in total.

name: colorado
sentence: The cities of Front Range closer to the mountains tend to be warmer in winter due to the Chinook wind that warms the region, sometimes bringing temperatures of 70°F (21°C) or higher in winter.

name: colorado
sentence: The mean July temperature is 55°F (13°C) in the morning and 90°F (32°C) in the afternoon.

name: colorado
sentence: The mean temperature in January is 18°F (−8°C) in the morning and 48°F (9°C) in the afternoon, although the variation between consecutive days may be 40°F (20°C).

name: colorado
sentence: To the west of the plains and in the foothills, there are a wide variety of climatic types.

name: colorado
sentence: Locations a few kilometres apart may experience totally different climatic conditions depending on the topography.

name: colorado
sentence: Most valleys have a semi-arid climate that is no different from the eastern plains, which moves to an alpine climate at the highest altitudes.

name: colorado
sentence: Microclimates also exist in local areas that cover almost the full spectrum of climates, including subtropical highlands (Cfb/Cwb), wet subtropicals (Cfa), wet continentals (Dfa/Dfb), Mediterraneans (Csa/Csb) and subarctics (Dfc).

name: colorado
sentence: Extreme climate change is common in Colorado, although much of the extreme climate change occurs in the less populated areas of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Storms are common east of the continental ditch in spring and summer, but are generally short.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is a common view in the mountains east of the Divide and across the eastern plains, especially the northeastern part of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is the most commonly reported serious weather hazard for the warm season and occasionally causes human injuries as well as significant material damage.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are prone to some of the largest hailstorms in North America.

name: colorado
sentence: An example is the violent hailstorms that struck Denver on July 11, 1990 and May 8, 2017, the latter being the most costly ever recorded in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are part of the extreme west of the Tornado gangway; some of the harmful tornadoes on the eastern plains include the 1990 Limon F3 tornado and the 2008 Windsor EF3 tornado, which devastated the small town.

name: colorado
sentence: Portions of the eastern plains see particularly frequent tornadoes, whether from mesocyclones in storms of supercells or less intense tillages, as in the Denver Convergence Zone (DCVZ).

name: colorado
sentence: The plains are also exposed to occasional flooding and particularly severe flash floods caused by both thunderstorms and rapid snowmelt in the mountains during warm weather.

name: colorado
sentence: Significant examples include the Denver flood in 1965, the Big Thompson flood in 1976 and the Colorado flood in 2013.

name: colorado
sentence: Hot weather is common in the summers in Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The city's record in 1901 for consecutive days above 90°F (32°C) was broken in the summer of 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: The new record of 24 consecutive days surpassed the previous record of nearly a week.

name: colorado
sentence: Much of Colorado is very dry, with an average of only 17 inches (430 millimetres) of precipitation per year across the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The state rarely goes through a period when part of it is not to some extent drought.

name: colorado
sentence: Lack of precipitation contributes to the severity of forest fires in the state, such as the 2002 Hayman Fire.

name: colorado
sentence: Other notable fires include the 2010 Fourmile Canyon Fire, the Waldo Canyon Fire, and the June 2012 High Park Fire, as well as the June 2013 Black Forest Fire.

name: colorado
sentence: Even these fires were overtaken by the pine mulch fire, Cameron Peak's fire, and the Eastern Troublefire in 2020, all three of the largest fires in Colorado history (see Colorado Forest Fires in 2020).

name: colorado
sentence: However, some mountainous areas of Colorado receive a large amount of moisture from winter snowfall.

name: colorado
sentence: The spring melting of these snows often causes large flows of water in the Yampa River, Colorado River, Rio Grande, Arkansas, North Platte River and South Platte River.

name: colorado
sentence: Water flowing from the Colorado Rocky Mountains is a very important source of water for farms, towns and cities in southwestern New Mexico, Arizona, Utah and Nevada, as well as for the Midwest, such as Nebraska and Kansas, and the southern states of Oklahoma and Texas.

name: colorado
sentence: A significant amount of water is also diverted to be used in California; from time to time (formerly naturally and regularly), water flows reach northern Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest ambient air temperature ever recorded in Colorado was 115°F (46.1°C) on July 20, 2019, at the John Martin Dam.

name: colorado
sentence: The official minimum air temperature was −61°F (−51.7°C) on 1 February 1985 at Maybell.

name: colorado
sentence: In spite of its mountainous terrain, Colorado is relatively calm on the seismic plane.

name: colorado
sentence: The National Earthquake Information Centre of the United States is located in Golden.

name: colorado
sentence: On 22 August 2011, an earthquake of magnitude 5.3 occurred 14 km west-southwest of the city of Trinidad.

name: colorado
sentence: There were no casualties and only a small number of damage was reported.

name: colorado
sentence: It was the second earthquake in Colorado history.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1973 an earthquake of magnitude 5.7 was recorded.

name: colorado
sentence: In the early morning of August 24, 2018, four minor earthquakes caught up with Colorado, ranging from magnitude 2.9 to 4.3.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has recorded 525 earthquakes since 1973, with a majority of 2 to 3.5 earthquakes on the Richter scale.

name: colorado
sentence: The area that is now the state of Colorado has been inhabited by Native Americans for over 13,000 years.

name: colorado
sentence: The Lindenmeier site of Larimer County contains artifacts dating from approximately 11200 B.C. to 3000 B.C.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern tip of the Rockies was an important migratory route that was important for the spread of the first peoples across the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The former Pueblo people lived in the valleys and mesas of the Colorado Plateau.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute Nation lived in the valleys of the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Western Rocky Mountains, even east of the Front Range these days.

name: colorado
sentence: The Apaches and the Comanches also lived in the eastern and south-eastern parts of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Sometimes the Arapaho Nation and the Cheyenne Nation moved westward to hunt across the high plains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Spanish Empire claimed Colorado as part of its New Mexico province before the United States became involved in the region.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States acquired a land claim from the Eastern Rocky Mountains with the purchase of Louisiana from France in 1803.

name: colorado
sentence: This American claim is in conflict with Spain's claim to the upper Arkansas basin as the exclusive commercial zone of its colony of Santa Fé de Nuevo México.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1806, Zebulon Pike led an American army reconnaissance expedition to the disputed area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Pike and his men were arrested by Spanish horsemen in the San Luis Valley the following February, taken to Chihuahua and expelled from Mexico the following July.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States abandoned its lands to the south and west of Arkansas and south of the 42nd parallel to the north and west of the 100th meridian to the west as part of the purchase of Florida from Spain with the Adams-Onís Treaty of 1819.

name: colorado
sentence: This treaty entered into force on 22 February 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Having established its border with Spain, the United States admitted to the Union the south-eastern part of the territory of Missouri as the state of Missouri on 10 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: The rest of Missouri territory, including what would become northeastern Colorado, became unorganized territory and remained so for 33 years on the issue of slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: After 11 years of war, Spain finally recognized Mexico's independence with the Treaty of Cordoba signed on August 24, 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico eventually ratified the Adams-Onís Treaty in 1831.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texas revolt of 1835–36 fomented a dispute between the United States and Mexico that finally broke out in the war between Mexico and the United States in 1846.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico ceded its northern territory to the United States with the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo at the conclusion of the war in 1848.

name: colorado
sentence: Most American settlers traveling west to Oregon, the new California gold fields, or the new Mormon colonies of Deseret State in the Salt Lake Valley, avoided the rugged southern rocky mountains, and instead followed the North Platte River and Sweetwater River to South Pass (Wyoming), the lowest passage of the continental divide between the southern Rocky Mountains and the central Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1849 the Mormons of the Salt Lake Valley organized the extralegal state of Deseret, claiming the entire Great Basin and all the lands drained by the Green, Grand and Colorado rivers.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. federal government totally refused to recognize the new Mormon government because it was theocratic and sanctioned plural marriage.

name: colorado
sentence: Instead, the 1850 compromise divided the Mexican Cessation and the northwestern claims of Texas into a new state and two new territories, the State of California, the territory of New Mexico and the territory of Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: On 9 April 1851, Mexican settlers from the Taos region settled in the village of San Luis and then in the Territory of New Mexico, later becoming the first permanent Euro-American colony in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1854, Senator Stephen A. Douglas persuaded the United States Congress to divide the unorganized territory east of the Continental Divide into two new organized territories, Kansas Territory and Nebraska Territory, and an unorganized southern region known as Indian Territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Each new territory had to decide the fate of slavery within its borders, but this compromise served only to fuel the animosity between the free soil and the pro-slavery factions.

name: colorado
sentence: Gold seekers organized the provisional government of Jefferson's territory on August 24, 1859, but the new territory did not obtain the approval of the United States Congress in the debate on slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: The election of Abraham Lincoln as President of the United States on 6 November 1860 led to the secession of nine southern slave states and the threat of civil war between states.

name: colorado
sentence: In an effort to increase the political power of the states of the Union, Congress dominated by the Republican Party quickly admitted the eastern part of Kansas territory to the Union as a free state of Kansas on 29 January 1861, leaving the western part of Kansas territory, and its gold mining areas, as unorganized territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Thirty days later, on February 28, 1861, James Buchanan, the outgoing president of the United States, signed a convention act organizing the free territory of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The original boundaries of Colorado remain unchanged, with the exception of changes to government surveys.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado name was chosen because it was commonly believed that the Colorado River came from the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1776, the Spanish priest Silvestre Vélez de Escalante reported that the Amerindians of the area knew the river as Rio Colorado for the red-brown silt that the river bore mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1859, a topographical expedition of the American army led by Captain John Macorb established the confluence of the Green River with the Grand River in what is now Canyonlands National Park in Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: Maccomb identified confluence as the source of the Colorado River.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 12, 1861, South Carolina artillery opened fire on Fort Sumter to begin the American Civil War.

name: colorado
sentence: While many gold lovers enjoyed Confederation, the vast majority remained fiercely loyal to the cause of the Union.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1862 a cavalry force from Texas invaded the territory of New Mexico and seized Santa Fe on 10 March.

name: colorado
sentence: The purpose of this western campaign was to seize or disrupt the gold fields of Colorado and California and seize the ports of the Pacific Ocean for Confederation.

name: colorado
sentence: A force hastily organized by Colorado volunteers moved from Denver City, Colorado Territory, to Col Glorieta, New Mexico Territory, to block the Texans.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 28, New Mexico's Coloradans and local volunteers arrested the Texans at the battle of Col Glorieta, destroyed their cannons and supply cars, and dispersed 500 of their horses and mules.

name: colorado
sentence: Texans were forced to retreat to Santa Fe.

name: colorado
sentence: Having lost the supplies for their campaign and found little support for New Mexico, the Texans abandoned Santa Fe and returned to San Antonio in defeat.

name: colorado
sentence: The Confederation has made no further attempts to seize the southwestern United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1864, the Governor of the Territory John Evans appointed the Reverend John Chivington as colonel of Colorado volunteers with orders to protect white settlers of Cheyenne and Arapaho warriors accused of stealing cattle.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Chivington ordered his men to attack a band of Cheyenne and Arapaho who camped along Sand Creek.

name: colorado
sentence: Chivington reported that his troops killed over 500 warriors.

name: colorado
sentence: The militia returned to Denver City in triumph, but several officers reported that the so-called battle was a flagrant massacre of Indians at peace, that most of the deaths were women and children, and that the bodies of the dead had been hideously mutilated and desecrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Army investigations have condemned the action, and next President Andrew Johnson has asked Governor Evans for his resignation, but none of the perpetrators have ever been punished.

name: colorado
sentence: This event is now known as the Sand Creek massacre.

name: colorado
sentence: In the middle of and after the civil war, many discouraged prospectors returned home, but some stayed and developed mines, mills, farms, ranches, roads and towns in Colorado territory.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 14, 1864, James Huff discovered silver near the Col d'Argentine, the first of many silver strikes.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1867, the Union Pacific Railway laid its tracks west as far as Weir, now Julesburg, in the northeast corner of the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: The Pacific Union established a link with the Central Pacific Railway at the summit of Promontory, Utah, on 10 May 1869, to form the first Transcontinental Railway.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver Pacific railway reached Denver in June the following year, and the Kansas Pacific arrived two months later to forge the second line across the continent.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1872 rich veins of silver were discovered in the San Juan Mountains on the Ute Indian Reserve in southwestern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Utes were withdrawn from the San Juans the following year.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 3, 1875, the United States Congress passed enabling legislation setting out the conditions for the territory of Colorado to become a state.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 1, 1876 (four weeks after the United States Centennial), US President Ulysses S. Grant signed a proclamation in which he admitted Colorado to the Union as 38th State and earned it the name "State of the Centennial".

name: colorado
sentence: The discovery of a major silver lode near Leadville in 1878 triggered the silver boom in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Sherman Silver Buy Act of 1890 reinvigorated silver mining, and Colorado's last gold strike, but the largest one, at Cripple Creek a few months later, attracted a new generation of gold researchers.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado women were granted the right to vote on November 7, 1893, making Colorado the second state to grant universal suffrage and the first by a popular vote (men of Colorado).

name: colorado
sentence: The repeal of the Sherman Silver Purchase Act in 1893 resulted in a dramatic collapse of Colorado's mining and agricultural economy, but the state recovered slowly and steadily.

name: colorado
sentence: Between the 1880s and 1930s, Denver's floriculture industry became a major industry in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This period became known locally as the gold rush of carnations.

name: colorado
sentence: The poor working conditions and discontent of the miners led to several major clashes between the strikers and the Colorado National Guard, including the Western Federation of Minors (1903-1904) and the Colorado Coal War, including the Ludlow massacre, which killed a dozen women and children.

name: colorado
sentence: Both the 1913-1914 Coal War and the 1920 Denver tramway strike led to the intervention of federal troops to put an end to the violence.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1927, the Columbine mine massacre resulted in the death of six strikers following a confrontation with the Colorado Rangers.

name: colorado
sentence: It is estimated that more than 5,000 miners from Colorado, many immigrants, have died in accidents since the records began to be formally collected following an accident in Crested Butte which killed 59 in 1884.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado became the first Western state to host a major political assembly when the Democratic Party met in Denver in 1908.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 1930 U.S. census, Colorado's population for the first time exceeded one million residents.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado suffered greatly during the Great Depression and Dust Bowl of the 1930s, but a great wave of immigration after the Second World War boosted Colorado's fortune.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism has become a pillar of the state economy, and high technology has become a major economic driver.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimated that Colorado's population exceeded 5 million in 2009.

name: colorado
sentence: Three American Navy warships were called the USColorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The first USColorado was named for the Colorado River and served in the civil war and later the Asian squadron, where he was attacked during the Korean expedition of 1871.

name: colorado
sentence: The last two ships were named in honor of the state, including the USColorado battleship that served during the Second World War in the Pacific from 1941.

name: colorado
sentence: At the time of the attack on Pearl Harbor, this USColorado was located at the naval base of San Diego, Calif. and thus went unharmed.

name: colorado
sentence: On 11 September 1957, a plutonium fire occurred at the Rocky Flats plant, resulting in significant plutonium contamination in the surrounding populated areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Since its disappearance by trapping and poisoning the Grey Wolf (Canis lupus) of Colorado in the 1930s, a pack of wolves has recolonized Moffat County, Colorado in northwestern Colorado in 2019.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the Colorado population was 5,758,736 in 2019, an increase of 14.51% since the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's most populated city and capital, Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Greater Denver metropolitan area, with an estimated population of 3,515,374 in 2017, is considered the largest metropolitan area in the state and is located in the Front Range urban corridor, which has approximately five million inhabitants.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest increases are expected in the Front Range urban corridor, especially in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: The fastest growing counties were Douglas and Weld.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's population centre is located just north of the village of Crichell, Jefferson County.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2010 United States Census, Colorado's population was 5,029,196.

name: colorado
sentence: The racial composition of the State population was:

name: colorado
sentence: Hispanic and Latin American peoples, whatever their race, make up 20.7 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, Colorado's main ancestry groups are German (22 per cent), including Swiss and Austrian nationalities, Mexico (18 per cent), Irish (12 per cent) and English (12 per cent).

name: colorado
sentence: People who report German ancestry are particularly numerous in the Front Range, the Rocky Mountains (Central West Counts) and the eastern/high plains.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a large proportion of Hispanic citizens, mainly Mexicans and Americans, in Metropolitan Denver, Colorado Springs, as well as in the small towns of Greeley and Pueblo, and elsewhere.

name: colorado
sentence: The south, south-west and south-east of Colorado have a large number of Hispanos, descendants of the first settlers of Spanish colonial origin.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1940, the Census Bureau reported that the population of Colorado was 8.2% Hispanics and 90.3% Non-Hispanic Whites.

name: colorado
sentence: The Hispanic population of Colorado has continued to grow rapidly in recent decades.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2019, Hispanics accounted for 22 per cent of Colorado's population and non-Hispanic whites for 70 per cent.

name: colorado
sentence: The English spoken in Colorado has many Spanish idioms.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado also has large African-American communities in Denver, Montbello, Five Points, Whittier and many other parts of East Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The state has a large number of Asian-Americans of Mongolian, Chinese, Filipino, Korean, South Asian and Japanese origin.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest population of Asian Americans is found on the south and south-east sides of Denver, as well as some on the south-west side of Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver metropolitan area is seen as more liberal and diverse than the majority of the state in terms of political issues and environmental concerns.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2006, Colorado recorded a total of 70,331 births.

name: colorado
sentence: (Issue rate of 14.6 per thousand.)

name: colorado
sentence: In 2007, non-Hispanic Whites were involved in 59.1% of all births.

name: colorado
sentence: About 14.06 per cent of these births involved a non-Hispanic white person and a person of a different race, most often with a couple including a Hispanic.

name: colorado
sentence: One birth involving at least one Hispanic person accounted for 43% of births in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: At the 2010 census, Colorado has the seventh percentage of Hispanics (20.7 per cent) in the United States behind New Mexico (46.3 per cent), California (37.6 per cent), Texas (37.6 per cent), Arizona (29.6 per cent), Nevada (26.5 per cent) and Florida (22.5 per cent).

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, the Hispanic population is estimated at 918,899 inhabitants, or about 20 per cent of the total population of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has the fifth largest population of Mexican Americans, behind California, Texas, Arizona, and Illinois.

name: colorado
sentence: In percentage, Colorado ranks 6th among Mexican-Americans, behind New Mexico, California, Texas, Arizona and Nevada.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2011, 46% of Colorado's population under one year of age were minorities, meaning that they had at least one non-Hispanic white parent.

name: colorado
sentence: Note: The births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race, giving a higher overall number.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2017, Colorado had the second lowest fertility rate in the United States outside New England, after Oregon, with 1.63 children per woman.

name: colorado
sentence: The Title X Family Planning Program and Warren Buffett's intrauterine device grant contributed significantly to the decline in pregnancy.

name: colorado
sentence: Spanish is the second language to be spoken in Colorado after English.

name: colorado
sentence: An Amerindian language is still spoken in Colorado, Colorado River Numic (Ute).

name: colorado
sentence: The main religious affiliations of the Colorado population are 64% Christians, including 44% Protestants, 16% Catholic, 3% Mormon and 1% Eastern Orthodox.

name: colorado
sentence: Other religious breaks are 1% Jewish, 1% Muslim, 1% Buddhist and 4% other.

name: colorado
sentence: Unaffiliated persons account for 29% of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest denominations according to the number of adherents in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 811,630; non-denominational evangelical Protestants with 229,981; and the Church of Jesus Christ of last-day saints with 151,433.

name: colorado
sentence: According to several studies, Coloradans have the lowest rates of obesity in any state in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, 24 per cent of the population was considered obese from a medical point of view and, if it was the lowest in the country, it had fallen from 17 per cent in 2004.

name: colorado
sentence: According to a report published in the Journal of the American Medical Association, Colorado residents had a life expectancy of 80.21 years in 2014, the longest in a U.S. state.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of film productions have been filmed on site in Colorado, particularly in major westerns such as True Grit, The Searchers, Butch Cassidy and Sundance Kid.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of historic military forts, railways with trains still in operation, phantom mining cities have been used and transformed for historical accuracy in well-known films.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of panoramic highways and mountain passes that have helped to highlight the free road in films such as Vanishing Point, Bingo and Starman.

name: colorado
sentence: Some Colorado landmarks have been featured in films such as The Stanley Hotel in Dumb and Dumber and The Shining and the Sculptured House in Sleeper.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2015, Furious 7 was to film footage on Pikes Peak Highway in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The TV series Good Luck Charlie was filmed in Denver, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Office of Film and Television found that more than 400 films were shot in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also several film festivals in Colorado, including Aspen Shortsfest, Boulder International Film Festival, Castle Rock Film Festival, Denver Film Festival, Festivus Film Festival (finished 2013), Mile High Horror Film Festival, Moondance International Film Festival, Mountainfilm at Telluride, Rocky Mountain Women's Film Festival and Telluride Film Festival.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its southwest and Rocky cuisine.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexican restaurants are important throughout the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado, was named the most gourmet city in America 2010 by Bon Appétit.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder and Colorado in general are home to a number of national food and beverage companies, premium restaurants and agricultural markets.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado also has more master sommeliers per capita than any other city, including San Francisco and New York City.

name: colorado
sentence: The Food & Wine Classic takes place annually in June in Aspen, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Aspen is also recognized as the culinary capital of the Rocky Mountains region.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is known for its steak, but today has a diversified culinary scene with many restaurants.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado wines include award-winning varieties that have attracted a positive opinion from outside the state.

name: colorado
sentence: With traditional Vitis vinifera grape-based wines as well as cherries, peaches, plums and honey, Colorado wines have won quality national and international awards.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's wine-growing regions are home to the highest vineyards in the United States, with most of the state's viticulture being between 4,000 and 7,000 feet (1,219 and 2,134 m) above sea level.

name: colorado
sentence: The mountainous climate ensures hot summer days and cool nights.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to two U.S. wine regions of the Grand Valley AVA and the Western Elks AVA, where most of the state's vineyards are located.

name: colorado
sentence: However, an increasing number of wineries are located along the Front Range.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, Wine Enthusiast Magazine named Colorado's Grand Valley AVA in Mesa County, Colorado, as one of ten wine travel destinations in the world.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to many nationally renowned microbreweries, including the New Belgium Brewing Company, Odell Brewing Company, Great Divide Brewing Company, and Bristol Brewing Company.

name: colorado
sentence: The northern Colorado region in the vicinity and between the towns of Denver, Boulder and Fort Collins is known as the "Napa Valley of Beer" because of its high density of artisanal breweries.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is open to cannabis (marijuana) tourism.

name: colorado
sentence: With the adoption of their 64th State Amendment in 2013, Colorado became the first state in the Union to legalize the medicinal, industrial and recreational use of marijuana (2000).

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's marijuana industry sold $1.31 billion in 2016 and $1.26 billion in the first three quarters of 2017.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2016, the government generated $194 million in tax revenues, fees and licences on legal marijuana sales.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado regulates hemp as a part of the plant with less than 0.3% THC.

name: colorado
sentence: Amendment 64, adopted by voters in the 2012 general election, requires the Colorado State legislature to enact laws governing the cultivation, processing and sale of recreational marijuana and industrial hemp.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 4, 2014, Senator Bill 14-184 on the oversight of the Colorado Industrial Hemp Program was introduced for the first time, and was finally signed by Governor John Hickenlooper on May 31, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 7, 2000, 54% of Colorado voters adopted Amendment 20, which amends the Constitution of the State of Colorado to allow the medical use of marijuana.

name: colorado
sentence: The medical use of marijuana by the patient, within the following limits, is lawful:

name: colorado
sentence: Currently, Colorado has listed "eight medical conditions for which patients can use marijuana: cancer, glaucoma, HIV/AIDS, muscle spasms, seizures, severe pain, nausea and severe cachexia, or dramatic weight loss and muscle atrophy."

name: colorado
sentence: While the governor, John Hickenlooper has allocated about half of the 13 million dollars of the state "Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund" to medical research in Budget 2014.

name: colorado

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is the southernmost state in New England in the northeastern United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the 2010 Census, it has the highest per capita income, the Human Development Index (0.962) and the median household income in the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is bordered by Rhode Island to the east, Massachusetts to the north, New York to the west, and Long Island Sound to the south.

name: connecticut
sentence: Its capital is Hartford, its most populous city is Bridgeport.

name: connecticut
sentence: Geographically, the state is part of New England, and although its cultural history emanates from the region in the modern era, major sections of it are increasingly linked to the three-state region with New York and New Jersey.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state is named for the Connecticut River, which approximately bisects the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The word "Connecticut" is derived from various anglicized spellings of "Quononoquett (Conanicut)," a Mohegan-Pequot word for "tidal river length".

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European settlers in Connecticut were Dutch who established a small, short-lived settlement called Fort Hoop in Hartford at the confluence of the park and Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Half of Connecticut was originally part of the Dutch colony New Netherlands, which included much of the land between the Connecticut and Delaware rivers, although the first major colonies were established by the English in the 1630s.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thomas Hooker led a band of disciples from Massachusetts Bay colony and founded the Connecticut colony

name: connecticut
sentence: The colonies of Connecticut and New Haven have prepared documents of the Fundamental Orders, considered the first constitutions in America.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662, the three colonies were merged under a royal charter, making Connecticut a Crown colony.

name: connecticut
sentence: It was one of the Thirteen Colonies that rejected British rule in the American Revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is the third smallest state by region, the 29th most populous, and the fourth densest of the 50 states.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is known as the "Constitutional State", the "Nutmeg State", the "Provisions State" and the "Land of Holy Habitudes".

name: connecticut
sentence: It influenced the development of the U.S. federal government (see Connecticut Compromise).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River, the Thames River and Long Island Sound ports have given Connecticut a strong maritime tradition that continues today.

name: connecticut
sentence: The government also has a long history of hosting the financial services sector, including insurance companies in Hartford and hedge funds in Fairfield County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is bordered south by Long Island Sound, west by New York, north by Massachusetts and east by Rhode Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state capital and the fourth largest city is Hartford, and other large cities (by population) include Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, New Britain, Greenwich and Bristol.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is slightly bigger than Montenegro.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are 169 cities in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest peak in Connecticut is Bear Mountain, in Salisbury, in the northwest corner of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest point is just east of Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New York (42°3′ N, 73°29′ W), on the southern slope of Mount Frissell, which peaks near Massachusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the extreme opposite, many coastal cities have areas less than 20 feet (6 m) above sea level.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a long maritime history and a reputation based on this history – but the state does not have a direct seafront (technically speaking).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut Coast is located in the Long Island Strait, which is an estuary.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state's access to the Atlantic Ocean is both west (to New York) and east (to the "race" near Rhode Island).

name: connecticut
sentence: This situation provides many safe harbours from ocean storms, and many transatlantic ships seek anchor in Long Island Strait when tropical cyclones pass off the upper east coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River crosses the centre of the state and flows into the Long Island Strait.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most populated metropolitan area in the centre of the state is located in the Connecticut Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Despite the relatively small size of Connecticut, it has wide regional variations in its landscape; for example, in the northwest of Litchfield Hills it includes mountains and horse farms, while in areas east of New Haven along the coast, the landscape includes coastal marshes, beaches and large-scale marine activities.

name: connecticut
sentence: The rural areas and small towns of Connecticut in the northeast and northwest corners of the state contrast strongly with its industrial cities such as Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven, located along the coastal highways of the New York border to New London, then north to Connecticut River to Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many towns in the northeast and northwest of Connecticut center around a green.

name: connecticut
sentence: Near the green usually stand historical visual symbols of New England's cities, such as a white church, colonial meeting house, colonial tavern or inn, several colonial houses, etc., establishing a picturesque historical appearance maintained for historical preservation and tourism.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many of the southern and coastal parts of Connecticut have been built and rebuilt over the years and are less like traditional New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The northern boundary of the state with Massachusetts is marked by the Southwick Jog or Granby Notch, a square detour of about 4.0 km to Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The origin of this anomaly is clearly established in a long series of temporary disputes and agreements that were finally concluded in 1804, when the residents of south Southwick sought to leave Massachusetts, and the city was divided into two.

name: connecticut
sentence: The southwestern border of Connecticut, where it is an exception to the state of New York, is marked by a panhandle in Fairfield County, which contains the cities of Greenwich, Stamford, New Canaan, Darien and parts of Norwalk and Wilton.

name: connecticut
sentence: This irregularity in the border is the result of territorial disputes at the end of the 17th century, culminating with New York abandoning its claim to the region, which residents considered to be part of Connecticut, in exchange for an equivalent area extending north of Ridgefield to the Massachusetts border, as well as the undisputed claim of Rye, New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: Areas maintained by the National Parks Service include the Appalachian National Scenic Trail, the Quinebaug Valley and Shetucket Rivers National Heritage Corridor, and Weir Farm National Historic Site.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is located in the rough transition zone between the southern end of the humid continental climate and the northern part of the humid subtropical climate.

name: connecticut
sentence: Northern Connecticut generally has a climate with cold winters with moderate snowfalls and warm and humid summers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The extreme south and the coast of Connecticut have a climate with cold winters with a mixture of rain and rare snow, and the long warm and humid summers typical of the middle and lower East coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut sees a fairly uniform precipitation pattern, with precipitation and snowfall spreading throughout the 12-month period.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut accounts for an average of 56% of the possible sunlight (higher than the U.S. national average), an average of 2400 hours of sunshine per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: The beginning of spring (April) can be slightly cool (40 to 50s F) or warm (65 to 70 F), while the middle and end of spring (late April/May) are warm.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the end of May, the Bermuda High Building created a southern flow of warm, humid tropical air, bringing warm weather conditions throughout the state, with average peaks in New London of 81°F (27°C) and 85°F (29°C) in Windsor Locks at the top of the summer in late July.

name: connecticut
sentence: Occasionally, heat waves of 90 to 100 °F (38 °C) occur in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Although summers are sunny in Connecticut, fast-moving summer thunderstorms can cause short flooding with thunder and lightning.

name: connecticut
sentence: Occasionally, these thunderstorms can be severe, and the condition averages one tornado per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the hurricane season, remnants of tropical cyclones occasionally affect the region, although a direct impact is rare.

name: connecticut
sentence: Weather conditions usually associated with the fall season generally begin in October and extend until the first days of December.

name: connecticut
sentence: The daily high temperatures in October and November vary between the 50's and 60's (Fahrenheit) with nights in the 40's and 30's.

name: connecticut
sentence: In early October, coloured foliage began in the northern parts of the state and moved south and east to southeast Connecticut in early November.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, remote southern and coastal areas have more oaks and hickory trees (and fewer maples) and are often less colourful than northern areas.

name: connecticut
sentence: In December, the highs of day are in 40°F for much of the state, and the lows of the night are below freezing.

name: connecticut
sentence: Winters (December to mid-March) are usually cold from south to north in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The coldest month (January) has high mean temperatures ranging from 38°F (3°C) in the coastal lowlands to 33°F (1°C) in the interior and northern portions of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Average annual snowfall varies from approximately 60 inches (1,500 mm) in the upper elevations of the northern part of the state to only 20-25 inches (510-640 mm) along the southeast coast of Connecticut (Branford to Groton).

name: connecticut
sentence: In general, any community north or west of Interstate 84 receives the most snow during a storm and throughout the season.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most Connecticut has less than 60 days of snow cover.

name: connecticut
sentence: Snow usually falls from late November to late March in the northern part of the State, and from early December to mid-March in the southern and coastal parts of the State.

name: connecticut
sentence: The record temperature of Connecticut is 106°F (41°C) which occurred in Danbury on 15 July 1995; the record low is -32°F (−36°C) which occurred in the Northwest Hills Falls Village on 16 February 1943 and in Coventry on 22 January 1961.

name: connecticut
sentence: The forests consist of a mixture of coastal forests from the northeast of Oak in the southern regions of the state, up to the high forests of New England and Acadia in the north-western part of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mountain Laurel (Kalmia latifolia) is the state flower and is native to low ridges in several parts of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Rosebay Rhododendron (maximum Rhododendron) is also native to the eastern Connecticut highlands and the Pachaug State Forest houses the Rhododendron Sanctuary trail.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Atlantic white cedar (Chamaecyparis thyoides), is found in wetlands in the southern part of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a native cactus (Opuntia humifusa), which is located in sandy coastal areas and low hills.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many types of beach grasses and wildflowers are also native to Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut extends over the hardiness areas of USDA plants 5b to 7a.

name: connecticut
sentence: Coastal Connecticut is the vast transition area where more southern and subtropical plants are grown.

name: connecticut
sentence: Prior to 1991, Connecticut had an income tax system focused solely on investments.

name: connecticut
sentence: Employment income was not taxed, but investment income was taxed at 13%, the highest rate in the United States, without deducting costs related to the production of investment income, such as interest on loans.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1991, under the authority of Governor Lowell P. Weicker Jr., an independent, the system was changed to a system in which taxes on employment income and investment income were equalized to the maximum rate of 4%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The new tax policy attracted investment firms to Connecticut; in 2019, Fairfield County was home to 16 of the world's 200 largest hedge funds.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, Connecticut's personal income tax rates were divided into seven tax brackets of 3% (on income up to $10,000); 5% ($10,000 to $50,000); 5.5% ($50,000 to $100,000); 6% ($100,000 to $200,000); 6.5% ($200,000 to $250,000); 6.9% ($250,000 to $500,000) and 6.9% above $500,000, with the additional amounts due in the instalment.

name: connecticut
sentence: All salaries of Connecticut residents are subject to government income tax, even if they are earned outside the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, in such cases, Connecticut's income tax should be withheld only to the extent that Connecticut's tax exceeds the amount withheld by the other administration.

name: connecticut
sentence: Since New York has higher income tax rates than Connecticut, this actually means that Connecticut residents working in New York have no Connecticut income tax withheld.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut allows a credit for taxes paid to other jurisdictions, but since residents working in other states are still subject to Connecticut's income tax, they may be liable for taxes if the jurisdiction credit does not fully offset Connecticut's tax amount.

sentence: Connecticut collects a sales tax of 6.35% on the retail sale, rental or rental of most of the property.

sentence: There are no additional sales taxes imposed by the local courts.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is a state in the Pacific Northwest Region of the United States of America.

name: idaho
sentence: It borders Montana to the east and northeast, Wyoming to the east, Nevada and Utah to the south, and Washington and Oregon to the west.

name: idaho
sentence: To the north, it shares a small portion of the Canadian border with the Province of British Columbia.

name: idaho
sentence: With a population of approximately 1.7 million and an area of 33,570 square miles (216,400 km2), Idaho is the 14th largest, the 12th least populated and the 7th least dense of the 50 American states.

name: idaho
sentence: The capital of the State and the largest city are Boise.

name: idaho
sentence: For thousands of years Idaho has been inhabited by Amerindian peoples.

name: idaho
sentence: At the beginning of the 19th century, Idaho was considered to be part of Oregon, a disputed region between the United States and the British Empire.

name: idaho
sentence: It officially became American territory with the signing of the Oregon Treaty of 1846, but a separate Idaho territory was only organized in 1863, instead of being included for periods in the Oregon Territory and the Washington Territory.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho was finally admitted to the Union on 3 July 1890, becoming the 43rd state.

name: idaho
sentence: As part of the Pacific Northwest (and the associated Cascadia bioregion), Idaho is divided into several distinct geographical and climatic regions.

name: idaho
sentence: The north of the state, the relatively isolated Idaho Panhandle, is closely linked to the east of Washington State with which it shares the Pacific Time Zone – the rest of the state uses the Mountain Time Zone.

name: idaho
sentence: The southern part of the state includes the Snake River Plain (which is home to most of the population and farmland).

name: idaho
sentence: The southeastern part of the state includes part of the Great Basin.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho is quite mountainous and contains several sections of the Rocky Mountains.

name: idaho
sentence: The United States Forest Service owns approximately 38% of Idaho land, the highest proportion of all states.

name: idaho
sentence: Industries important to the government economy include manufacturing, agriculture, mining, forestry and tourism.

name: idaho
sentence: A number of scientific and technological companies have their headquarters in Idaho or factories there, and the State also contains the National Laboratory of Idaho, which is the country's largest energy department.

name: idaho
sentence: The agricultural sector of Idaho provides many products, but the state is better known for its potato cultivation, which accounts for about a third of the national yield.

name: idaho
sentence: The official nickname of the state is "the State of Gem", which refers to the natural beauty of Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: The origin of the name remains a mystery.

name: idaho
sentence: In the early 1860s, when the U.S. Congress planned to organize a new territory in the Rocky Mountains, the name "Idaho" was suggested by George M. Willing, a politician who presented himself as an unrecognized delegate of the unofficial territory of Jefferson.

name: idaho
sentence: Willing claimed that the name was derived from a Shoshone term meaning "the sun comes from the mountains" or "the name of the mountains," but it was later revealed that there was no such term and Willing claimed that he was inspired to give the name when he met a little girl named "Ida".

name: idaho
sentence: As the name appeared to be made, the U.S. Congress finally decided to appoint the Colorado Territory region instead when it was created in February 1861, but by the time this decision was made, the city of Idaho Springs, Colorado had already been appointed according to Willing's proposal.

name: idaho
sentence: In the same year, Congress established Colorado Territory, a county called Idaho County, which was established in eastern Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: The county was named after a steamboat called Idaho, which was launched on the Columbia River in 1860.

name: idaho
sentence: It is not clear whether the steamship was named before or after Willing's request was revealed.

name: idaho
sentence: In any event, part of Washington's territory, including Idaho County, was used to create Idaho's territory in 1863.

name: idaho
sentence: Finally, the name was given to the Idaho Territory, which later became the US state.

name: idaho
sentence: Despite this lack of evidence for the origin of the name, many textbooks well in the 20th century repeated as Willing's narrative the name "Idaho" derived from the term Shoshone "ee-da-how".

name: idaho
sentence: A 1956 Idaho history manual says:

name: idaho
sentence: An alternative to etymology attributes the name to the Plains Apache word "ídaahęя" IPA: [í.ta=.h="] (enemy) which was used in reference to the Comanche.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho borders six American states and one Canadian province.

name: idaho
sentence: Washington and Oregon are to the west, Nevada and Utah to the south, and Montana and Wyoming to the east.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho also has a short border with the Canadian province of British Columbia to the north.

name: idaho
sentence: The landscape is rugged with some of the largest unspoilt natural areas in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: For example, at 2.3 million acres (930,000 hectares), the Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness area is the largest contiguous wilderness protected area in the American continent.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho is a state of the Rocky Mountains with abundant natural resources and picturesque areas.

name: idaho
sentence: The state has snowy mountain ranges, rapids, vast lakes and steep canyons.

name: idaho
sentence: The waters of the Snake River pass through Hells Canyon, the deepest gorge in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: Shoshone Falls descends from cliffs above Niagara Falls.

name: idaho
sentence: By far the largest river in the Idaho is the Snake River, a major tributary of the Columbia River.

name: idaho
sentence: The Snake River flows from Yellowstone into northwestern Wyoming via the Snake River Plain in southern Idaho before turning north, leaving the state at Lewiston before joining the Columbia at Kennewick.

name: idaho
sentence: The other major rivers are the Clark Fork/Pend Oreille River, the Spokane River and the main tributaries of the Snake River, including the Clearwater River, the Salmon River, the Boise River and the Payette River.

name: idaho
sentence: The Salmon River flows into the Snake River in Canyon Hells and forms the southern boundary of Nez Perce County on its north shore, of which Lewiston is the county seat.

name: idaho
sentence: Lewiston Harbour, at the confluence of Clearwater and Snake Rivers, is the furthest port on the west coast, 465 miles from the Pacific River, at Astoria, Oregon.

name: idaho
sentence: The vast majority of the Idaho population lives in the Snake River Plain, a valley from east to west of Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: The valley contains the major towns of Boise, Meridian, Nampa, Caldwell, Twin Falls, Idaho Falls and Pocatello.

name: idaho
sentence: The plain served as an easy passage through the Rocky Mountains for settlers westward on the Oregon Trail, and many settlers chose to settle in the area rather than risk the perfidious route through the Blue Mountains and the Cascade Range to the west.

name: idaho
sentence: The western region of the plain is known as the Treasure Valley, linked between the Owyhee Mountains in the southwest and the Boise Mountains in the northeast.

name: idaho
sentence: The central region of the Snake River Plain is known as the Magic Valley.

name: idaho
sentence: The highest point of the Idaho is Borah Peak, 3,859 m, in the Lost River chain, north of Mackay.

name: idaho
sentence: The lowest point on the Idaho, 216 metres, is in Lewiston, where the Clearwater River reaches the Snake River and continues to Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: Sawtooth is often considered the most famous mountain range in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: Other Idaho mountain ranges include Bitterroot, White Cloud Mountains, Lost River, Clearwater Mountains and Salmon River Mountains.

name: idaho
sentence: The climate of Idaho varies enormously.

name: idaho
sentence: Although the western border of the state is about 350 miles (560 km) from the Pacific Ocean, maritime influence is still felt in Idaho, especially in winter when cloud cover, humidity and precipitation are at their maximum.

name: idaho
sentence: This influence has a moderate effect in winter, where temperatures are not as low as might be expected for a northern state where altitudes are mostly high.

name: idaho
sentence: Maritime influence is less important in the eastern part of the state where rainfall is often reversed, with wetter summers and drier winters, and seasonal temperature differences are more extreme, showing a more semi-arid continental climate.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho can be warm, although prolonged periods of more than 98°F (37°C) are rare, except for the lowest point of altitude, Lewiston, who sees little snow as a result.

name: idaho
sentence: The warm summer days are tempered by low relative humidity and cooler evenings during the summer months since, for most states, the greatest diurnal temperature difference is often in summer.

name: idaho
sentence: Winters may be cold, although long periods of bitter cold under zero are unusual.

name: idaho
sentence: The highest temperature of Idaho at 118°F (48°C) was recorded at Orofino on 28 July 1934; the lowest temperature of all times at -60°F (−51°C) was recorded at the Island Park Dam on 18 January 1943.

name: idaho
sentence: Humans may have been present in the Idaho area 14,500 years ago.

name: idaho
sentence: Excavations at the Wilson Butte Cave near Twin Falls in 1959 revealed signs of human activity, including arrow tips, that rank among the oldest artifacts dated in North America.

name: idaho
sentence: The American Indians who predominated in the area included the Nose Perce in the north and the Shoshone in the north and west to the south.

name: idaho
sentence: A late upper paleolithic site was identified by archaeologists at Cooper's Ferry in western Idaho, near the town of Cottonwood, in 2019.

name: idaho
sentence: According to evidence found at the site, the first people lived in this area 15,300 to 16,600 years ago, before the Beringia Land Bridge of about 1,000 years old.

name: idaho
sentence: The discoverers, Professor of Anthropology Loren Davis and his colleagues, pointed out that they have similarities with tools and artifacts discovered in Japan from 16,000 to 13,000 years old.

name: idaho
sentence: The discovery also showed that the first people may not have come to North America by land, as had been said before.

name: idaho
sentence: On the contrary, they probably crossed the water along a Pacific coastal route.

name: idaho
sentence: An early presence of French Canadian trappers is visible in the names and toponyms: Nose Percé, Coeur d'Alène, Boisé, Payette, some pre-existing expeditions of Lewis and Clark and Astorien, who themselves included a large number of French and Métis guides recruited for their knowledge of the terrain.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho, as part of Oregon, was claimed by the United States and Great Britain until the United States acquired undisputed jurisdiction in 1846.

name: idaho
sentence: From 1843 to 1849, the Idaho of today was de facto under the jurisdiction of the Provisional Government of Oregon.

name: idaho
sentence: When Oregon became a state, what is now Idaho was in what remained of the original Oregon territory not part of the new state, and designated as Washington territory.

name: idaho
sentence: Between that date and the creation of the Idaho territory on March 4, 1863, at Lewiston, parts of the present state were included in the Oregon, Washington and Dakota territories.

name: idaho
sentence: The new territory included today's Idaho, Montana, and most Wyoming.

name: idaho
sentence: The Lewis and Clark expedition crossed Idaho in 1805 on the Pacific Road and in 1806 on the return, largely along both directions of the Clearwater River.

name: idaho
sentence: The first non-Aboriginal colony was Kullyspell House, established on the shore of Pend Oreille Lake for the fur trade in 1809 by David Thompson of the Northwest Company.

name: idaho
sentence: In 1812 Donald Mackenzie, who worked for the Pacific Fur Company at the time, established a post on the lower Clearwater River near Lewiston today.

name: idaho
sentence: This position, known as "MacKenzie's Post" or "Clearwater", operated until the Pacific Fur Company was purchased by the North West Company in 1813, after which it was abandoned.

name: idaho
sentence: The first attempts of organized communities, within the current borders of Idaho, were launched in 1860.

name: idaho
sentence: Lewiston was the first permanent community incorporated in 1861.

name: idaho
sentence: After a few tribulations as a territory, including the chaotic transfer from the territorial capital of Lewiston to Boise, the abandonment of the right to vote of the Mormonist polygamous confirmed by the Supreme Court of the United States in 1877, and a federal attempt to divide the territory between the territory of Washington which obtained state status in 1889, a year before Idaho, and the state of Nevada which had been a state since 1864, Idaho obtained state status in 1890.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho was one of the hardest hit by the Pacific Northwest States during the Great Depression.

name: idaho
sentence: Prices fell for Idaho's main crops: in 1932, a bushel of potatoes earned only ten cents compared to $1.51 in 1919, while Idaho's farmers saw their annual income fall from $686 in 1929 to $250 in 1932.

name: idaho
sentence: In recent years, Idaho has expanded its business base as a state of tourism and agriculture to include science and technology industries.

name: idaho
sentence: Science and technology have become the largest economic centre in the state (more than 25 per cent of total government revenue) and are more important than agriculture, forestry and mining combined.

name: idaho
