sentence: The official language of Illinois is English, although between 1923 and 1969, the state law gives official status to "the American language".

name: illinois
sentence: Nearly 80% of Illinois residents speak English as their mother tongue, and most others speak English as their second language fluently.

name: illinois
sentence: A number of American English dialects are spoken, ranging from English from the interior of North America and African-American English around Chicago, to English from Midland American in Central Illinois, to Southern English in the extreme south.

name: illinois
sentence: More than 20% of the Illinois speak a language other than English at home, whose Spanish is by far the most common, with more than 12% of the total population.

name: illinois
sentence: A large number of Polish speakers are present in the Chicago metropolitan area.

name: illinois
sentence: French Illinois Country has mostly disappeared in Illinois, although it is still celebrated in the French Historical Colonial District.

name: illinois
sentence: Roman Catholics constitute the largest religious denomination in Illinois; they are heavily concentrated in and around Chicago and account for nearly 30% of the population of the state.

name: illinois
sentence: However, taken together as a group, the various Protestant denominations represent a higher percentage of the population of the State than Catholics.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, the number of Catholics in Illinois was 3,648,907.

name: illinois
sentence: The largest Protestant denominations were the United Methodist Church, with 314,461 members, and the Southern Baptist Convention, with 283,519 members.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has one of the highest concentrations of Lutherans in Missouri synodal in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois played an important role in the Latter Day Saint, Nauvoo, Illinois movement, becoming a gathering place for Mormons in the early 1840s.

name: illinois
sentence: Nauvoo was the place of the crisis of succession, which led to the separation of the Mormon movement into several holy sects of the Day of Latter.

name: illinois
sentence: The Church of Jesus Christ of the Last Days Saints, the largest sect to emerge from the Mormon schism, has more than 55,000 members in Illinois today.

name: illinois
sentence: There are many adherents of other abrahamic denominations in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Very concentrated in the metropolitan area of Chicago, the adherents of the Muslim, Baha'i and Jewish religions all call the State House.

name: illinois
sentence: Muslims were the largest non-Christian group, with 359,264 members.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has the highest concentration of Muslims per State in the country, with 2,800 Muslims per 100,000 citizens.

name: illinois
sentence: The largest and oldest Baha'i worship house in the world is located in Wilmette, Illinois, The Chicago area has a very large Jewish community, especially in the suburbs of Skokie, Buffalo Grove, Highland Park and surrounding suburbs.

name: illinois
sentence: The former mayor of Chicago, Rahm Emanuel, is the first Jewish mayor of Windy City.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is also home to a large population of Hindus, Sikhs, Jain and Buddhists.

name: illinois
sentence: The Baha'i House of Worship in Wilmette is the centre of the worship of this religion in North America.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's gross domestic product was estimated at US$909 billion in 2019.

name: illinois
sentence: The government's gross domestic product in 2019 per capita was estimated at approximately $72,000.

name: illinois
sentence: In February 2019, the unemployment rate in Illinois was 4.2 per cent.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's minimum wage will increase to $15 per hour by 2025, making it one of the highest in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's main agricultural products are corn, soybeans, pork, livestock, dairy products and wheat.

name: illinois
sentence: In most years, Illinois is either the first or second state for the highest soybean production, with a harvest of 427.7 million bushels (11.64 million tonnes) in 2008, after Iowa's production of 444.82 million bushels (12.11 million tonnes).

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is the second largest producer of corn in the United States, with more than 1.5 billion bushels produced each year.

name: illinois
sentence: With a production capacity of 1.5 billion gallons per year, Illinois is a leading ethanol producer, ranked third in the United States in 2011.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a leader in food production and meat processing.

name: illinois
sentence: Although Chicago may no longer be "Hog Butcher for the World", the Chicago region remains a global centre for food manufacturing and meat processing, with many factories, processing houses and distribution facilities concentrated in the former Union Stock Yards region.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also produces wine and the state houses two U.S. wine regions.

name: illinois
sentence: In the area of The Meeting of the Great Rivers Scenic Byway, peaches and apples are grown.

name: illinois
sentence: The German agricultural immigrants who settled in Illinois in the middle and late 19th century were partly responsible for the profusion of fruit orchards in this area of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois universities are actively looking for alternative agricultural products as alternative crops.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is one of the country's leading manufacturers, with annual productivity of over $107 billion in 2006.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2011, Illinois was ranked 4th among the country's most productive manufacturing countries, behind California, Texas and Ohio.

name: illinois
sentence: About three-quarters of the state's manufacturers are located in the Northeastern Opportunity Return area, and 38% of the approximately 18,900 manufacturing plants in Illinois are located in Cook County.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2006, Illinois's major value-added manufacturing industries were chemical manufacturing ($18.3 billion), machine manufacturing ($13.4 billion), food manufacturing ($12.9 billion), manufactured metal products ($11.5 billion), transportation equipment ($7.4 billion), plastics and rubber products ($7.0 billion), and computer and electronic products ($6.1 billion).

name: illinois
sentence: By the early 2000s, Illinois's economy had become dependent on high value-added services, such as financial commerce, higher education, law, logistics and medicine.

name: illinois
sentence: In some cases, these services have been clustered around institutions that have listened to Illinois's economies.

name: illinois
sentence: For example, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, a trading stock for global derivatives, began its life as an agricultural futures market.

name: illinois
sentence: Other important non-manufacturing industries are publishing, tourism, and energy production and distribution.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2016, venture capital investors funded a total of approximately $62 billion in the U.S. economy.

name: illinois
sentence: Of this amount, Illinois-based companies received about $1.1 billion.

name: illinois
sentence: Similarly, in fiscal year 2016, the federal government spent $461 billion on contracts in the U.S. Of this amount, Illinois-based companies received approximately $8.7 billion.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a net importer of fuel for energy, despite significant coal resources and minor oil production.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois exports electricity, ranking fifth among states in terms of electricity production and seventh among states in terms of electricity consumption.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois coal industry originated in the mid-19th century when contractors such as Jacob Loose discovered coal in places such as Sangamon County.

name: illinois
sentence: Jacob Bunn contributed to the development of the Illinois coal industry and was a founder and owner of the Illinois Western Coal & Mining Company.

name: illinois
sentence: Approximately 68% of Illinois has coal strata of the Pennsylvania geological period.

name: illinois
sentence: According to the State of Illinois Geological Survey, 211 billion tonnes of bituminous coal are below the surface, having a total heating value greater than the estimated oil deposits on the Arabian Peninsula.

name: illinois
sentence: However, coal has a high sulphur content, which causes acid rain, unless special equipment is used to reduce sulphur dioxide emissions.

name: illinois
sentence: Many Illinois power plants are not equipped to burn high-sulphur coal.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1999, Illinois produced 40.4 million tons of coal, but only 17 million tons (42%) were consumed in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Most coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states and countries.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2008, Illinois exported three million tons of coal and is expected to export nine million tons of coal in 2011, with increasing energy demand in places such as China, India and other countries in Asia and Europe.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, Illinois was ranked third among the coal reserves recoverable for mine production in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of the coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states, while most of the coal burned for electricity in Illinois (21 million tonnes in 1998) is mined in the Wyoming Powder River Basin.

name: illinois
sentence: Mattoon has recently been selected as a site for the Department of Energy's FutureGen project, a 275-megawatt zero-emission experimental power plant that burns coal that the DOE has just funded.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, after a number of failures, the city of Mattoon emerged from the project.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a leading oil refinery in the U.S. Midwest, with a combined crude oil distillation capacity of nearly 900,000 barrels per day (140,000 m3/d).

name: illinois
sentence: However, Illinois has very limited crude oil reserves that account for less than 1% of the total U.S. reserves.

name: illinois
sentence: Residential heating is 81% of natural gas, compared with less than 1% of fuel oil.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks 14th in state oil production, with a daily production of about 28,000 barrels (4,500 m3) in 2005.

name: illinois
sentence: Nuclear power probably started in Illinois with the Chicago Pile-1, the first self-sufficient artificial reaction of the nuclear chain in the world's first nuclear reactor, built on the University of Chicago campus.

name: illinois
sentence: Six nuclear power stations are operating in Illinois: Braidwood, Byron, Clinton, Dresden, LaSalle and Quad Cities.

name: illinois
sentence: With the exception of the Clinton single unit plant, each of these facilities has two reactors.

name: illinois
sentence: Three reactors have been permanently shut down and are in various decommissioning stages: Dresden-1 and Zion-1 and 2.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranked first in 2010 in nuclear capacity and nuclear production.

name: illinois
sentence: The production of its nuclear power plants accounts for 12 per cent of the country's total.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2007, 48% of Illinois's electricity was generated using nuclear energy.

name: illinois
sentence: Operation Morris is the only highly radioactive waste storage facility in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is increasingly interested in the use of wind energy for electricity production.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of Illinois was classified in 2009 as "marginal or equitable" for wind power production by the U.S. Department of Energy, and some western sections were classified as "good" and parts of the south were classified as "poor".

name: illinois
sentence: These ratings apply to wind turbines with a hub height of 50 metres (160 feet); more recent wind turbines are larger, allowing them to reach stronger winds farther from the ground.

name: illinois
sentence: As a result, more and more Illinois regions have become potential wind farms.

name: illinois
sentence: In September 2009, Illinois had 1116.06 MW of installed wind power and an additional 741.9 MW were under construction.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranked ninth in the United States in terms of installed wind capacity and sixteenth in terms of potential capacity.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's large wind farms include Twin Groves, Rail Splitter, EcoGrove and Mendota Hills.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2007, wind power accounted for only 1.7% of Illinois's energy production, and it was estimated that wind power could provide 5 to 10% of the state's energy needs.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, the Illinois General Assembly mandated in 2007 that, by 2025, 25% of the electricity generated in Illinois would come from renewable resources.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is ranked second in corn production in the United States, and Illinois corn is used to produce 40% of ethanol consumed in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Archer Daniels Midland of Decatur, Illinois is the world's leading producer of corn ethanol.

name: illinois
sentence: The National Centre for Research on Corn to Ethanol (NCERC), the only institution in the world dedicated to research on how to convert corn to ethanol, is located on the campus of Edwardsville University in southern Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign is one of the partners of the Energy Biosciences Institute (EBI), a $500 million biofuel research project funded by the oil giant BP.

name: illinois
sentence: Taxes are collected by the Illinois Ministry of Revenue.

name: illinois
sentence: State income tax is calculated by multiplying net income by a flat rate.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1990, the rate was set at 3 per cent, but in 2010, the General Assembly voted for a temporary increase in the rate to 5 per cent; the new rate came into effect on 1 January 2011; the personal income rate partially collapsed on 1 January 2015 to 3.75 per cent, while corporate income tax fell to 5.25 per cent.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois did not succeed in adopting a budget from 2015 to 2017, after the 736-day budget impasse, a budget was adopted in Illinois after legislators overturned Governor Bruce Rauner's veto, raising the personal income rate to 4.95% and the corporate rate to 7%.

name: illinois
sentence: There are two rates for the government's sales tax: 6.25% for general goods and 1% for eligible food, drugs and medical devices.

name: illinois
sentence: Property tax is an important source of tax revenue for the tax districts of the local government.

name: illinois
sentence: Property tax is a local, non-state tax imposed by local government tax districts, which include counties, cantons, municipalities, school districts and special tax districts.

name: illinois
sentence: The property tax in Illinois is imposed only on real property.

name: illinois
sentence: On May 1, 2019, the Illinois Senator voted in favour of a constitutional amendment that would have been struck by the wording of the Illinois Constitution requiring a fixed tax on state income, by a vote of 73–44.

name: illinois
sentence: Had it been approved, the amendment would have allowed the state legislator to impose a tax on graduated income based on annual income.

name: illinois
sentence: Governor J.B. Pritzker approved it on May 27, 2019.

name: illinois
sentence: It was planned for a general election in 2020 and required the approval of 60% of voters to effectively amend the state constitution.

name: illinois
sentence: The amendment was not approved by Illinoisers, 55.1% of voters voting "No" at approval, and 44.9% voting "Yes".

name: illinois
sentence: In 2017, Chicago had the highest rate of state tax and local sales tax for an American city with a population of over 200,000, at 10.250%.

name: illinois
sentence: The state of Illinois has the second highest real estate tax rate: 2.31%, which is the second in New Jersey at 2.44%.

name: illinois
sentence: Toll roads are a user's tax on citizens and visitors to the State of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks seventh out of the 11 states with the most kilometers of toll roads, 282.1 miles.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago ranks fourth in America's most expensive toll roads per kilometre, with the Chicago Skyway charging 51.2 cents per mile.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has the 11th highest gasoline tax per state, at 37.5 cents per gallon.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois Hosts Many Museums

name: illinois
sentence: Many museums in Chicago are ranked among the best in the world.

name: illinois
sentence: These include the John G. Shedd Aquarium, the Field Museum of Natural History, the Chicago Art Institute, the Planetarium Adler, and the Museum of Science and Industry.

name: illinois
sentence: The modern Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum in Springfield is the largest and most frequented presidential library in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Museum has a collection of 13.5 million objects that tell the story of Illinois's life, land, people and art.

name: illinois
sentence: The ISM is among only 5% of the nation's museums accredited by the American Museum Alliance.

name: illinois
sentence: Other historical museums in the state include the Polish Museum of America in Chicago, the Manoir de Magnolia in Cairo, the Easley Pioneer Museum in Ipava, the Elihu Benjamin Washburne, Ulysses S. Grant Homes, both in Galena, and the Chanute Air Museum, located on the former Chanute Air Base in Rantoul.

name: illinois
sentence: The Chicago metropolitan area also houses two zoos: Brookfield Zoo, located about 10 miles west of downtown Brookfield, contains more than 2300 animals and covers 216 acres (87 ha).

name: illinois
sentence: Lincoln Park Zoo is located at Lincoln Park on the north side of Chicago, about 3 miles (4.8 km) north of the loop.

name: illinois
sentence: The zoo is home to over 35 acres (14 ha) of the park.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has been a leader in music education, hosting the Midwest Clinical International Band and Orchestra Conference since 1946, as well as the head office of the Illinois Music Educators Association (IMEA), one of the largest professional music educators organizations in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Every summer since 2004, Southern Illinois University Carbondale hosts the Southern Illinois Music Festival, which features dozens of performances throughout the region.

name: illinois
sentence: The leading artists of the past are Trio Eroica and violinist David Kim.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago, in the northeast corner of the state, is a major centre of music in the west-central United States where distinctive forms of blues (very responsible for the future creation of rock and roll), and home music, a genre of electronic dance music, have been developed.

name: illinois
sentence: The large migration of poor black workers from the South to industrial cities brought traditional jazz and blues music to the city, resulting in blues Chicago and "Chicago-style" Dixieland jazz.

name: illinois
sentence: Famous blues artists include Muddy Waters, Junior Wells, Howlin' Wolf and both Sonny Boy Williamsons; great jazz includes Nat King Cole, Gene Ammons, Benny Goodman and Bud Freeman.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is also well known for his soul music.

name: illinois
sentence: In the early 1930s, evangelical music began to gain popularity in Chicago because of Thomas A. Dorsey's contribution to the Baptist Church Pilgrim.

name: illinois
sentence: In the 1980s and 1990s, heavy rock, punk and hip hop also became popular in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: The Chicago orchestras include the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, the Chicago Lyric Opera and the Chicago Sinfonietta.

name: illinois
sentence: John Hughes, who moved from Grosse Pointe to Northbrook, has based many films from his hometown in Chicago and from his suburbs.

name: illinois
sentence: Ferris Bueller's Day Off, Home Alone, The Breakfast Club, and all of his films take place in Shermer, Illinois (the original name of Northbrook was Shermerville, and Hughes's High School, Glenbrook North High School, is on Shermer Road).

name: illinois
sentence: Most of the places in his films include Glenbrook North, the former Maine North High School, the Ben Rose House in Highland Park, and the famous Home Alone house in Winnetka, Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Like one of the most important cities in the United States, all major sports leagues have teams based in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: Many minor league teams also call Illinois their house.

name: illinois
sentence: These include the following:

name: illinois
sentence: The state has 13 athletic programs that compete in NCAA Division I, the highest level of university sport in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: The two most prominent are Illinois Fighting Illini and Northwestern Wildcats, both members of the Big Ten Conference and the only ones to participate in one of the so-called "Power Five Conferences".

name: illinois
sentence: The Fighting Illini football team won five national championships and three Rose Bowl games, while the men's basketball team won 17 conference seasons and played five four finals.

name: illinois
sentence: Meanwhile, the Wildcats won eight football championships and one Rose Bowl match.

name: illinois
sentence: The Northern Illinois Huskies of DeKalb, Illinois, competed in the Mid-American Conference winning four conference championships and winning an offer in the Orange Bowl as well as candidate Heisman Jordan Lynch in the quarterback.

name: illinois
sentence: The Huskies are the only other government team competing in the Football Bowl Subdivision, the high level of the NCAA football.

name: illinois
sentence: Four schools have football programs competing at the second level of Football Division I, the Football Championship Subdivision.

name: illinois
sentence: The State of Illinois Redbirds (Normal, adjacent to Bloomington) and the Salukis of southern Illinois (the latter representing the principal campus of the University of Southern Illinois in Carbondale) are members of the Missouri Valley Conference (MVC) for non-football sports and the Missouri Valley Football Conference (MVFC).

name: illinois
sentence: Western Illinois Leathernecks (Macomb) are full members of the Summit League, which does not sponsor football, but also of the MVFC.

name: illinois
sentence: The Panthers of Eastern Illinois (Charleston) are members of the Ohio Valley Conference (OVC).

name: illinois
sentence: The City of Chicago is home to four Division I programs that do not sponsor football.

name: illinois
sentence: The DePaul Blue Demons, with the major Lincoln Park and Loop campuses, are members of the Big East Conference.

name: illinois
sentence: The Loyola Ramblers, whose main campus straddles the Edgewater and Rogers Park community areas on the north side of the city, competed with the MVC.

name: illinois
sentence: The Flames of the UIC, close to the west next to the loop, are in the Horizon League.

name: illinois
sentence: The Cougars of Chicago State, on the south side of the city, participate in the Western Athletic Conference.

name: illinois
sentence: Finally, two non-football Division I programs are located in the lowest state.

name: illinois
sentence: The Bradley Braves (Peoria) are members of the MVC, and the SIU Edwardsville Cougars (in the Metro East region through the Mississippi River from St. Louis) participate in the OVC.

name: illinois
sentence: The city was once home to several other teams that either had not survived or did not belong to leagues that folded.

name: illinois
sentence: The NFL Arizona cardinals, currently playing in the Phoenix suburb of Glendale, Arizona, play in Chicago as Chicago cardinals until they moved to Saint Louis, Missouri after the 1959 season.

name: illinois
sentence: An NBA expansion team, known as Chicago Packers in 1961-1962, and Chicago Zephyrs the following year moved to Baltimore after the 1962-1963 season.

name: illinois
sentence: The franchise is now known as the Washington Wizards.

name: illinois
sentence: Peoria chiefs and Kane Cougars County are minor league baseball teams affiliated with the MLB.

name: illinois
sentence: The Schaumburg Boomers and Lake County Fielders are members of the North American League, and the Southern Illinois Miners, Gateway Grizzlies, Joliet Slammers, Windy City ThunderBolts and Normal CornBetters belong to the Frontier League.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition to the Chicago wolves, the AHL also owns the Rockford IceHogs, which serve as a subsidiary of the Chicago Blackhawk AHL.

name: illinois
sentence: The second incarnation of the Peoria Rivermen played in the SPHL.

name: illinois
sentence: Oval race tracks at Chicagoland Speedway in Joliet, Chicago Motor Speedway in Cicero and Gateway International Raceway in Madison, near St. Louis, hosted NASCAR, CART and IRL races, while the Sports Car Club of America, among other national and regional road racing clubs, visited the Autobahn Country Club in Joliet, the Blackhawk Farms Raceway in Beloit South and the former Meadowdale International Raceway in Carpentersville.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has a number of short tracks and dragstrips.

name: illinois
sentence: The drag track at Gateway International Raceway and Route 66 Raceway, which is located on the same property as the Chicagoland Speedway, both hosts of the NHRA drag races.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois offers several golf courses, such as Olympia Fields, Medinah, Midlothian, Cog Hill and Conway Farms, which often hosted the BMW, Western Open and Women's Western Open Championships.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, the State hosted 13 editions of the U.S. Open (last in Olympia Fields in 2003), six editions of the PGA Championship (last in Medina in 2006), three editions of the U.S. Women's Open (last in the Merit Club), the 2009 Solheim Cup (in Rich Harvest Farms) and the 2012 Ryder Cup (in Medinah).

name: illinois
sentence: The John Deere Classic has been a regular PGA Tour event in Quad Cities since 1971, while the Encompass Championship has been a Champions Tour event since 2013.

name: illinois
sentence: Previously, the LGGA State Farm Classic was an event on the LPGA circuit from 1976 to 2011.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Park System began in 1908 with what is now Fort Massac State Park, becoming the first park in a system comprising more than 60 parks and roughly the same number of recreational and wildlife areas.

name: illinois
sentence: Areas protected by the National Parks Service include the Illinois and Michigan Canal National Heritage Corridor near Lockport, the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail, Lincoln Home National Historic Site in Springfield, the Mormon Pioneer National Historic Trail, the Tears National Historic Trail, the American Discovery Trail and the Pullman National Monument.

name: illinois
sentence: The federal government also manages the Shawnee National Forest and the Tallgrass National Prairie of Midewin.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois government, under the Illinois Constitution, has three powers of government: executive, legislative, and judicial.

name: illinois
sentence: The executive branch is divided into several State-wide seats, with the governor as head of the executive branch.

name: illinois
sentence: Legislative functions are assigned to the Illinois General Assembly.

name: illinois
sentence: The judiciary consists of the Supreme Court and lower courts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois General Assembly is the state legislature, composed of 118 members of the Illinois House of Representatives and 59 members of the Illinois Senator.

name: illinois
sentence: The members of the General Assembly shall be elected at the beginning of each even year.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois Compiled Statutes (ILCS) are consolidated statutes of a general and permanent nature.

name: illinois
sentence: The executive branch consists of six elected officials and their offices, as well as many other departments.

name: illinois
sentence: The six elected are Governor, Lieutenant Governor, Attorney General, Secretary of State, Controller and Treasurer.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois government has many departments, agencies, boards and commissions, but the so-called code services provide most government services.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois Justice is Illinois's unified justice system.

name: illinois
sentence: It consists of the Supreme Court, the Court of Appeal and the mobile courts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Supreme Court oversees the administration of the judiciary.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's administrative divisions are counties, townships, police stations, cities, towns, villages and special-purpose districts.

name: illinois
sentence: The fundamental subdivision of Illinois is the 102 counties.

name: illinois
sentence: Eighty-five of the 102 counties are in turn divided into townships and districts.

name: illinois
sentence: Municipal authorities are towns, villages and incorporated cities.

name: illinois
sentence: Some communities have a membership rule, which allows them to govern themselves to some extent.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a fief democrat.

name: illinois
sentence: Historically, Illinois was a political swing state whose quasi-parity existed between the Republican and Democratic parties.

name: illinois
sentence: However, in recent elections, the Democratic Party gained ground, and Illinois became a strong "blue" state in presidential campaigns.

name: illinois
sentence: The votes in Chicago and most of Cook's counties have long been highly democrats.

name: illinois
sentence: However, "collar counties" (the suburbs surrounding Cook County, Illinois) may be considered moderate electoral districts.

name: illinois
sentence: College towns like Carbondale, Champaign, and Normal also meagre democratic.

name: illinois
sentence: Republicans continue to prevail in rural areas of northern and central Illinois, as well as in southern Illinois, outside the eastern part of St. Louis.

name: illinois
sentence: From 1920 to 1972, Illinois was carried by the winner of each of the 14 presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: In fact, the state has long been considered a national viewpoint, supporting the winner in all elections of the 20th century, with the exception of 1916 and 1976.

name: illinois
sentence: On the other hand, Illinois turned more towards the Democratic Party and voted for its presidential candidates in the last six elections; in 2000, George W. Bush became the first Republican to win the presidency without wearing either Illinois or Vermont.

name: illinois
sentence: The local politician and Chicago resident Barack Obama easily won the state's 21 electoral votes in 2008, with 61.9% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, outgoing Governor Pat Quinn was re-elected with 47% of the vote, while Republican Mark Kirk was elected Senator with 48% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2012, President Obama again easily carried Illinois, with 58% to the Republican candidate Mitt Romney 41%.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2014, Republican Bruce Rauner defeated Governor Quinn from 50% to 46% to become Illinois's first Republican governor in 12 years after being sworn in on January 12, 2015, while Democratic Senator Dick Durbin was re-elected with 53% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2016, Hillary Clinton won Illinois with 55% of the vote, and Tammy Duckworth defeated incumbent Mark Kirk with 54% to 40%.

name: illinois
sentence: George W. Bush and Donald Trump are the only Republican presidential candidates to win without wearing either Illinois or Vermont.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2018, Democratic JB Pritzker defeated Bruce Rauner for the post of governor with 54% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: State policy has been infamous for cases of highly visible corruption, as well as for cross-formers, such as governors Adlai Stevenson and James R. Thompson.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2006, former Governor George Ryan was sentenced for racketeering and corruption, resulting in six and a half years in prison.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2008, Governor Rod Blagojevich received a criminal complaint for corruption, following allegations that he had conspired to sell the seat of Senator left vacant by President Barack Obama to the highest bidder.

name: illinois
sentence: Subsequently, on 7 December 2011, Rod Blagojevich was sentenced to 14 years in prison on these charges, as well as to perjury while testifying during the case, totalling 18 convictions.

name: illinois
sentence: Blagojevich was indicted and sentenced by the legislator, forcing him to leave office.

name: illinois
sentence: At the end of the 20th century, MP Dan Rostenkowski was imprisoned for mail fraud; former Governor and Federal Judge Otto Kerner, Jr. was imprisoned for corruption; Secretary of State Paul Powell was investigated and found to have gained great wealth through bribes; and the Auditor of State for Public Accounts (Controller) Orville Hodge was imprisoned for embezzlement.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1912 William Lorimer, the boss of the Chicago GOP, was expelled from the Senate for corruption, and in 1921 Governor Len Small was found to have swindled the state of a million dollars.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has shown a strong presence in the presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: Three presidents claimed Illinois as their political basis when they came to the presidency: Abraham Lincoln, Ulysses S. Grant, and more recently Barack Obama.

name: illinois
sentence: Lincoln was born in Kentucky but moved to Illinois at the age of 21.

name: illinois
sentence: He served in the General Assembly and represented the 7th District of Congress in the United States House of Representatives before his election to the presidency in 1860.

sentence: Indiana has a constitutional form of democratic republican government with three branches: the executive, including an elected governor and lieutenant governor; the legislature, consisting of an elected bicameral General Assembly; and the judiciary, the Supreme Court of Indiana, the Indiana Court of Appeal and circuit courts.

sentence: Indiana's energy production consists mainly of the consumption of fossil fuels, mainly coal.

name: indiana
sentence: It has 24 coal-fired power stations, including the largest power plant in the country, Gibson Generating Station, which crosses the Wabash River from Mount Carmel, Illinois.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana also houses the coal-fired power plant with the highest sulphur dioxide emissions in the United States, the Gallagher power plant west of New Albany.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2010, Indiana estimated that coal reserves amounted to 57 billion tons, and the State's mining activities produced 35 million tons of coal per year.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana also has at least 900 million barrels of oil reserves in the Trenton field, although they are not easily recoverable.

name: indiana
sentence: While Indiana has committed to increasing the use of renewable resources such as wind, hydro, biomass or solar energy, progress has been very slow, mainly due to the continued abundance of coal in southern Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Most of the new state facilities are coal gasification facilities.

name: indiana
sentence: Another source of hydroelectric power.

name: indiana
sentence: Wind power production has been developed.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's wind capacity was estimated in 2006 to have increased from 30 MW to 50 m in height to 40,000 MW in height to 70 m, and to 130,000 MW in height to 100 m in 2010.

name: indiana
sentence: By the end of 2011, Indiana had installed 1340 MW of wind turbines.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis International Airport serves the largest area in Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: It opened in November 2008 and offers a midfield passenger terminal, halls, an air traffic control tower, a parking garage, and airfield and apron improvements.

name: indiana
sentence: Other major airports are the Evansville Regional Airport, the Fort Wayne International Airport (which houses 122 National Air Guard Fighter Wing) and the South Bend International Airport.

name: indiana
sentence: A long-standing proposal to make Gary Chicago International Airport the third major Chicago airport received a boost in early 2006 with the approval of $48 million in federal funding over the next 10 years.

name: indiana
sentence: No airline operates from Terre Haute regional airport but is used for private aircraft.

name: indiana
sentence: Since 1954, the 181 Wing Fighter of the Indian National Air Guard has been stationed there, but the 2005 Realignment and Closure Base (BRAC) proposal indicated that the 181st would lose its fighter mission and F-16 aircraft, leaving the Terre Haute facility with a combat aircraft facility.

name: indiana
sentence: Louisville International Airport, opposite the Ohio River in Louisville, Kentucky, serves southern Indiana, as does the Kentucky Cincinnati/North International Airport in Hebron, Kentucky.

name: indiana
sentence: Many residents of Northwest Indiana, primarily in the Chicago metropolitan area, use Chicago airports, O'Hare International Airport and Chicago Midway International Airport.

name: indiana
sentence: The major American interstate highways in Indiana are I-64, I-65, I-265, I-465, I-865, I-69, I-469, I-70, I-74, I-80, I-90, I-94 and I-275.

name: indiana
sentence: The various roads that intersect in and around Indianapolis, as well as its historic status as a railway hub, and the canals that crossed Indiana, are the source of the state's motto, the crossroad of America.

name: indiana
sentence: There are also many U.S. highways and highways maintained by the Indiana Department of Transportation.

name: indiana
sentence: These are numbered under the same convention as the United States.

name: indiana
sentence: - The highways.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana enables highways of different classifications to have the same number.

name: indiana
sentence: For example, I-64 and Indiana State Road 64 both exist (rather close to each other) in Indiana, but are two separate roads that have no relation to each other.

name: indiana
sentence: A $3 billion project covering period I-69 is underway.

name: indiana
sentence: The project was divided into six sections, with the first five sections (linking Evansville to Martinsville) now completed.

name: indiana
sentence: The sixth and final phase in Indianapolis is under preparation.

name: indiana
sentence: Once completed, the I-69 will cross an additional 142 miles (229 km) across the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Indiana counties use a grid-based system to identify county roads; this system has replaced the old arbitrary system of road numbers and names, and (among other things) it is much easier to identify call sources placed in the 9-1-1 system.

name: indiana
sentence: These systems are easier to implement in the glacially flat northern and central parts of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Rural counties in the southern third of the state are less likely to have grids and more likely to rely on non-systematic road names (e.g., Crawford, Harrison, Perry, Scott and Washington counties).

name: indiana
sentence: There are also counties in the northern parts of the state that have never set up a grid or implemented only a part of it.

name: indiana
sentence: Some counties are also located in a grid system that is almost similar to that of diamonds (e.g. Clark, Floyd, Gibson and Knox counties).

name: indiana
sentence: Such a system is also almost unnecessary in these situations.

name: indiana
sentence: One day Knox County used two different network systems for county roads because the county was constructed using two different survey grids, but it has since decided to use road names and to combine roads instead.

name: indiana
sentence: In particular, the county road network of St. Joseph County, the main city of which is South Bend, uses perennial tree names (i.e., the name of the province).

name: indiana
sentence: Ash, Hickory, ironwood, etc.)

name: indiana
sentence: In alphabetical order for north-south roads and presidential names and other notable names (e.g. Adams, Edison, Lincoln Way, etc.)

name: indiana
sentence: In alphabetical order for East-West roads.

name: indiana
sentence: There are exceptions to this rule in the city centre of South Bend and Mishawaka.

name: indiana
sentence: The east-west roads of Hamilton County continue the network of numbered Indianapolis streets from 96th Street to Marion County Line to 296th Street to Tipton County Line.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has over 4,255 miles of track, 91 per cent of which are operated by Class I railways, primarily CSX Transportation and Norfolk Southern Railway.

name: indiana
sentence: Other Class I railways in Indiana include the Canadian National Railway and the Soo Line Railway, a subsidiary of the Canadian Pacific Railway, and Amtrak.

name: indiana
sentence: The remaining miles are operated by 37 regional, local, switching and terminal railways.

name: indiana
sentence: The South Shore Line is one of the largest suburban rail networks in the country, from Chicago to South Bend.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is implementing a comprehensive railway plan prepared in 2002 by the Parsons Corporation.

name: indiana
sentence: Many recreational trails, such as the Monon Trail and Cardinal Greenway, were created from abandoned tracks.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana ships over 70 million tonnes of cargo annually by water, which ranks 14th among all U.S. states.

name: indiana
sentence: More than half of the Indiana border is water, which includes 400 miles (640 km) of direct access to two major freight routes: the Great Lakes/St. Lawrence.

name: indiana
sentence: Lawrence Seaway (through Lake Michigan) and the inland waterway system (through the Ohio River).

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana harbours manage three major ports, including Burns Harbor, Jeffersonville and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: In Evansville, three public port facilities and several private port facilities are served throughout the year by five major barge lines operating on Ohio.

name: indiana
sentence: Evansville has been an American port of entry for more than 125 years.

name: indiana
sentence: As a result, it is possible to have international goods shipped to Evansville in customs.

name: indiana
sentence: International freight can then clear customs at Evansville rather than a coastal port.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's constitution of 1816 was the first in the country to implement a publicly funded school system.

name: indiana
sentence: It also allocated one canton to a public university.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the plan proved far too idealistic for a pioneering society, as the tax money was not available for its organization.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1840s Caleb Mills insisted on the need for tax-funded schools, and in 1851 his councils were included in the new state constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1843, the Legislature affirmed that African-Americans could not attend public schools, leading to the founding of the Union Literary Institute and other schools for them, financed by donations or by students themselves.

name: indiana
sentence: Although the growth of the public school system was hindered by legal entanglements, many public elementary schools were used in 1870.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Indiana children attend public schools, but nearly 10% attend private and parish schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Approximately half of all Indiana students are enrolled in state-funded four-year schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana public schools have undergone several changes in Indiana history.

name: indiana
sentence: The modern standards of State schools have been applied throughout the State.

name: indiana
sentence: The new standard was adopted in April 2014.

name: indiana
sentence: The overall objective of these new state standards is to ensure that Indiana students have the skills and requirements to enter college or labour after graduation from high school.

name: indiana
sentence: State standards can be found for almost all the main subjects taught in Indiana's public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Mathematics, the arts of English and language, science and social studies are among the highest and highest priority standards.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2017, the Indiana Ministry of Education reported that the overall rate of graduation was 87.19 per cent for exempt graduates and 80.10 per cent for non-state graduates.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest educational institution is the University of Indiana, whose flagship campus was approved as an Indiana Seminary in 1820.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana State University was established as the State Normal School in 1865.

name: indiana
sentence: The other three independent state universities are Vincennes University (Founded in 1801 by Indiana Territory), Ball State University (1918) and the University of Southern Indiana (1965 as ISU – Evansville).

name: indiana
sentence: Many private colleges and universities in Indiana are affiliated with religious groups.

name: indiana
sentence: Notre-Dame University, Mariale University and Saint-François University are popular Catholic schools.

name: indiana
sentence: The universities affiliated to the Protestant denominations are Anderson University, Butler University, Huntington University, Manchester University, Indiana Wesleyan University, Taylor University, Franklin College, Hanover College, DePauw University, Earlham College, Valparaiso University, Indianapolis University and Evansville.

name: indiana
sentence: The government's community college system, the Ivy Tech Community College of Indiana, serves nearly 200,000 students per year, making it the largest public post-secondary institution in the state and the largest state-accredited community college system.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2008, the University of Indiana system agreed to transfer most of its associate diplomas (2 years) to the Ivy Tech Community College system.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has several universities ranked among the best in the 2013 US News & World Report.

name: indiana
sentence: Notre Dame University is ranked among the top 20 with the University of Indiana Bloomington and Purdue being ranked among the top 100.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana University – Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) has recently been one of the top 200 rankings of US News & World Report.

name: indiana
sentence: Butler, Valparaiso and the University of Evansville are ranked among the top ten in the regional rankings of Midwest University.

name: indiana
sentence: Purdue engineering programs are ranked eighth in the country.

name: indiana
sentence: In addition, Taylor University holds first place at Midwest Rankings Regional College and the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is considered the best undergraduate engineering school (where a PhD is not offered) for 15 consecutive years.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is a state in the U.S. Midwest, bordered by Mississippi in the east and Missouri and Big Sioux in the west.

name: iowa
sentence: It is bordered by six states: Wisconsin in the northeast, Illinois in the east and southeast, Missouri in the south, Nebraska in the west, South Dakota in the northwest and Minnesota in the north.

name: iowa
sentence: In colonial times, the Iowa was part of French Louisiana and Spanish Louisiana; its state flag was inspired by the flag of France.

name: iowa
sentence: After purchasing in Louisiana, people laid the foundations for an agriculture-based economy at the heart of the corn belt.

name: iowa
sentence: In the second half of the 20th century, the agricultural economy of Iowa made the transition to a diversified economy of manufacturing, processing, financial services, information technology, biotechnology and green energy production.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the 26th largest of the total area and the 30th most populated of the 50 American states.

name: iowa
sentence: The capital of the state, the most populated city, and the largest metropolitan area entirely situated in the state is Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Part of the large metropolitan area of Omaha in Nebraska extends to three counties in southwestern Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is one of the safest American states in which to live.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa derives its name from the people of Ioway, one of the many Amerindian nations whose territory included the future state at the time of European colonization.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa is bordered by Mississippi, east, and Missouri, and Big Sioux, west.

name: iowa
sentence: The north limit is a line along 43 degrees, 30 minutes north latitude.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern boundary is the Des Moines River and a not quite straight line along about 40 degrees 35 minutes north, as decided by the U.S. Supreme Court in Missouri v. Iowa (1849) after a dam between Missouri and Iowa known as the honey war.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the only state whose eastern and western borders are almost entirely formed by rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Carter Lake, Iowa, is the only town in the state west of the Missouri River.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has 99 counties but 100 seats because Lee County has two.

name: iowa
sentence: The State capital, Des Moines, is located in Polk County.

name: iowa
sentence: Geology of the Iowa bedrock generally increases in western to eastern age.

name: iowa
sentence: In northwestern Iowa, cretaceous substrates can be 74 million years old; in eastern Iowa, Cambrian substrates are about 500 million years old.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is generally not flat

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa can be divided into eight forms of land based on glaciation, soils, topography and drainage of rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Loess Hills are located along the western border of the State, some of which are several hundred feet thick.

name: iowa
sentence: The northeastern Iowa, along the upper Mississippi River, is part of the Driftless area, consisting of steep hills and valleys that seem almost mountainous.

name: iowa
sentence: Several natural lakes exist, including Spirit Lake, western Okoboji Lake and eastern Okoboji Lake in northwestern Iowa (see Great Lakes of Iowa).

name: iowa
sentence: To the east, is Clear Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Artificial lakes include Odessa Lake, Saylorville Lake, Red Rock Lake, Coralville Lake, MacBride Lake and Rathbun Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Prior to the European settlement, 4 to 6 million acres of state land were covered with wetlands, and about 95% of these wetlands were drained.

name: iowa
sentence: The natural vegetation of Iowa consists of tall grass and savannah grasslands in the highlands, dense forests and wetlands in floodplains and protected river valleys, and hen nest wetlands in the northern prairies.

name: iowa
sentence: Most of Iowa is used for agriculture; crops cover 60 per cent of the state, grasslands (mainly pastures and hay with some grasslands and wetlands) cover 30 per cent, and forests 7 per cent, urban areas and water 1 per cent each.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern part of Iowa is categorized as the transition ecoregion between the central forest and the grasslands.

name: iowa
sentence: The drier northern part of Iowa is classified as part of the high prairies of the Centre.

name: iowa
sentence: There is a shortage of natural areas in Iowa; less than 1% of the tall grass prairies that once covered most of Iowa remain intact; only 5% of the wetlands in the state pothole remain and most of the native forest has been lost.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2005, Iowa ranked 49th in the United States in the area of public lands.

name: iowa
sentence: Threatened or endangered animals in Iowa include the lower inner tern, the plover, the Indiana bat, the pallided sturgeon, the Pleistocene snail of Iowa, the pearl mussel of the Higgins eye and the Topeka sturgeon.

name: iowa
sentence: Endangered or threatened plants include the western prairie fringe orchid, eastern prairie fringe orchid, Mead's milkweed, prairie clover and northern wild monks.

name: iowa
sentence: The explosion in the number of high-density farms in Iowa has led to an increase in water contamination in rural areas and a decrease in air quality.

name: iowa
sentence: Other factors that have a negative impact on the Iowa environment include the intensive use of old coal-fired power plants, the use of fertilizers and pesticides from agricultural production and the reduction of the Jordanian aquifer.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa has a humid continental climate throughout the state (Köppen climate classification Dfa) with extremes of both heat and cold.

name: iowa
sentence: The average annual temperature at Des Moines is 50°F (10°C); for some locations in the north, such as Mason City, the figure is approximately 45°F (7°C), while Keokuk, on the Mississippi River, is 52°F (11°C).

name: iowa
sentence: Snowfall is common, with Des Moines getting about 26 days of snowfall per year, and other places, such as Shenandoah getting about 11 days of snowfall in a year.

name: iowa
sentence: The spring inaugurates the beginning of the weather season.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has an average of about 50 days of stormy activity per year.

name: iowa
sentence: The annual 30-year average of the Tornadoes in Iowa is 47.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2008, twelve people were killed by tornadoes in Iowa, making it the most deadly year since 1968 and the second largest tornado in a year with 105, the total of 2001.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa summers are known for heat and humidity, with diurnal temperatures sometimes close to 90 °F (32 °C) and sometimes above 100 °F (38 °C).

name: iowa
sentence: Average winters of the state are known to fall well below freezing, even below -18°F (−28°C).

name: iowa
sentence: The warmest temperature of Iowa at 118°F (48°C) was recorded at Keokuk on 20 July 1934 during a nationwide heat wave; the lowest temperature of all times at -47°F (−44°C) was recorded at Washta on 12 January 1912.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a relatively smooth gradient of variable precipitation throughout the state, with regions in the southeast receiving an average of more than 38 inches (97 cm) of rain per year, and the northwest receiving less than 28 inches (71 cm).

name: iowa
sentence: The precipitation trend across Iowa is seasonal, with more rain falling in the summer months.

name: iowa
sentence: Nearly on a state-wide basis, the driest month is January or February, and the wettest month is June, due to frequent showers and thunderstorms, some of which produce hail, harmful winds and/or tornadoes.

name: iowa
sentence: At Des Moines, about in the middle of the state, more than two-thirds of the 34.72-inch (88.2-cm) rain falls from April to September, and about half of the annual average rainfall falls from May to August, reaching a peak in June.

name: iowa
sentence: When the American Indians arrived in what is now the Iowa more than 13,000 years ago, they were hunters and gatherers living in a glacial landscape of the Pleistocene.

name: iowa
sentence: By the time European explorers and traders visited Iowa, the Indians of America were largely farmers established with complex economic, social and political systems.

name: iowa
sentence: This transformation took place gradually.

name: iowa
sentence: During the archaic period (10,500-2,800 years ago), American Indians adapt to local environments and ecosystems, slowly becoming more sedentary as populations increase.

name: iowa
sentence: More than 3,000 years ago, at the end of the archaic period, the Iowa American Indians began to use domesticated plants.

name: iowa
sentence: In the following period, there was increased dependence on agriculture and social complexity, with increased use of mounds, ceramics and specialized livelihoods.

name: iowa
sentence: During the late prehistoric period (from about 900 AD), increased corn use and social changes led to prosperous and nucleous social settlements.

name: iowa
sentence: The arrival of European goods and diseases in the protohistoric era led to dramatic demographic changes and economic and social upheavals, with the arrival of new tribes and the first European explorers and traders.

name: iowa
sentence: There were many Indian tribes living in Iowa at the time of the European exploration.

name: iowa
sentence: The tribes that were probably descendants of the prehistoric Oneota include Dakota, Ho-Chunk, Ioway and Otoe.

name: iowa
sentence: The tribes that arrived in Iowa at the end of prehistoric or protohistoric periods include the Illiniwek, Meskwaki, Omaha and Sauk.

name: iowa
sentence: The first European explorers known to document Iowa were Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet who travelled the Mississippi in 1673 to document several indigenous villages on the Iowa side.

name: iowa
sentence: The region of Iowa was claimed for France and remained a French territory until 1763.

name: iowa
sentence: The French, before their imminent defeat in the French and Indian War, transferred the property to their ally, Spain.

name: iowa
sentence: Spain exercised very loose control over the Iowa region, granting trade licences to French and British traders, who established trading stations along the Mississippi and Des Moines rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa was part of a territory known as Louisiana or Louisiana, and European traders were interested in lead and furs obtained by Aboriginal peoples.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki effectively controlled trade on Mississippi in the late 18th and early 19th centuries.

name: iowa
sentence: Among the first Mississippi merchants were Julien Dubuque, Robert de la Salle and Paul Marin.

name: iowa
sentence: Along the Missouri River, at least five French and English trading houses were built prior to 1808.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1800, Napoleon Bonaparte took control of Louisiana in Spain by a treaty.

name: iowa
sentence: After the purchase of Louisiana in 1803, the Congress divided the purchase of Louisiana into two parts: the territory of Orléans and the district of Louisiana, the Iowa of today falling into the latter.

name: iowa
sentence: Indiana Territory was established in 1800 to exercise jurisdiction over this part of the district.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of the Iowa was mapped by Zebulon Pike in 1805, but it was only when Fort Madison was built in 1808 that the United States established tenuous military control over the area.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was built to control the trade and establish American domination over the Upper Mississippi, but it was misconceived and hostile by the Sauk and Fox, many of whom were allies with the British, who had not abandoned the claims of the territory.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was defeated by the British-backed Aboriginal people in 1813 during the War of 1812, and Fort Shelby, on the Dog Prairie in Wisconsin, also fell into British hands.

name: iowa
sentence: Black Hawk took part in the siege of Fort Madison.

name: iowa
sentence: Another small military outpost was established along Mississippi in Bellevue today.

name: iowa
sentence: This poorly located stockade was also attacked by hundreds of Aboriginal people in 1813, but was successfully defended and later abandoned until settlers returned to the area in the mid-1830s.

name: iowa
sentence: After the war, the United States restored control of the area through the construction of Fort Armstrong, Fort Snelling in Minnesota, and Fort Atkinson in Nebraska.

name: iowa
sentence: The United States encouraged settlement on the eastern side of Mississippi and Indian abduction to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: A disputed 1804 treaty between Quashquame and William Henry Harrison, which delivered much of Illinois to the United States, enraged many Sauk and led to the Black Hawk War of 1832.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki sold their land in the Mississippi Valley in 1832 in the Black Hawk purchase and sold their remaining land in Iowa in 1842, most of which settled on a reserve in Kansas.

name: iowa
sentence: Many Meskwaki later returned to Iowa and settled near Tama, Iowa; the Meskwaki settlement remains to date.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1856, the Iowa Legislature passed an unprecedented law allowing Meskawki to buy the land.

name: iowa
sentence: However, contrary to the unprecedented act of the Iowa Legislature, the United States federal government, by resorting to treaties, forced the Ho-Chunk of Iowa in 1848, and the Dakota of Iowa in 1858.

name: iowa
sentence: Western Iowa around the Council's modern bluffs was used as an Indian reserve for the members of the Council of Three Fires.

name: iowa
sentence: The first American settlers formally moved to Iowa in June 1833.

name: iowa
sentence: Mainly, they were families from Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, Indiana, Kentucky and Virginia who settled along the western shores of Mississippi and founded the modern cities of Dubuque and Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: On 4 July 1838, the United States Congress created the territory of Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: President Martin Van Buren appointed Robert Lucas as Governor of the Territory, which at the time had 22 counties and a population of 23,242 inhabitants.

name: iowa
sentence: Almost immediately after obtaining territorial status, a request for state status was made.

name: iowa
sentence: On 28 December 1846, Iowa became the 29th state of the Union when President James K. Polk signed the Iowa Admission Bill.

name: iowa
sentence: Once admitted to the Union, the problems of the state border solved, and most of its land purchased from the natives, Iowa gave its direction to development and organized campaigns for settlers and investors, boasting the rich agricultural lands of the young border state, good citizens, free and open society, and good government.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a long tradition of state and county fairs.

name: iowa
sentence: The first and second Iowa State Fairs took place in the eastern part of the more developed state in Fairfield.

name: iowa
sentence: The first fair took place from October 25 to 27, 1854, for a cost of approximately 323.

name: iowa
sentence: Subsequently, the fair moved to places closer to the centre of the State and found, in 1886, a permanent house in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Since then, the State Fair has been held every year, with a few exceptions: 1898 due to the war between Spain and America and the World Fair held in Omaha, Nebraska, nearby; 1942-19, due to the Second World War, because the fairs were used as a supply depot for the army; and 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa supported the Union during the civil war, voting strongly for Abraham Lincoln, although there was an anti-war movement "Copperhead" in the state, caused in part by a fall in crop prices caused by the war.

name: iowa
sentence: There was no battle in the state, although the Battle of Athens, the Missouri, 1861, was fought just opposite the River Des Moines of Croton, Iowa, and the shots of the battle landed in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa sent a lot of food to the armies and eastern cities.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of Iowa's support of the Union can be attributed to Samuel J. Kirkwood, his first wartime governor.

name: iowa
sentence: Of a total population of 675,000, approximately 116,000 men were assigned to military missions.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa contributed proportionately more men to military civil war service than any other state, north or south, sending more than 75,000 volunteers to the armed forces, more than a sixth of whom were killed before the Confederates went to Appomattox.

name: iowa
sentence: Most of them fought in the major campaigns in the Mississippi Valley and the South.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa troops fought at Wilson's Creek in Missouri, Pea Ridge in Arkansas, Forts Henry and Donelson, Shiloh, Chattanooga, Chickamauga, Missionary Ridge, and Rossville Gap, as well as Vicksburg, Iuka and Corinth.

name: iowa
sentence: They served with the Potomac Army in Virginia and fought under General Union Philip Sheridan in the Shenandoah Valley.

name: iowa
sentence: Many of them died and were buried in Andersonville.

name: iowa
sentence: They walked on General Nathaniel Banks' reckless expedition to Red River.

name: iowa
sentence: Twenty-seven Iowans were awarded the Medal of Honour, the highest military decoration awarded by the U.S. government, which was first awarded during the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has several Brigadier Generals and four principal Generals, namely Grenville Mellen Dodge, Samuel R. Curtis, Francis J. Herron and Frederick Steele, and many of its generals occupy a prominent position in the state and the country after the war.

name: iowa
sentence: After the civil war, the population of Iowa continued to increase dramatically from 674,913 in 1860 to 1,624,615 in 1880.

name: iowa
sentence: The American Civil War brought briefly higher profits.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1917, the United States entered World War I and farmers and all Iowans experienced an economy in times of war.

name: iowa
sentence: For farmers, change was significant.

name: iowa
sentence: Since the beginning of the war in 1914, Iowa farmers had experienced economic prosperity, which lasted until the end of the war.

name: iowa
sentence: In the economic sector, Iowa has also undergone significant changes.

name: iowa
sentence: Starting with the first industries developed in the 1830s, which were mainly intended for the processing of cultivated materials in the region, Iowa experienced a gradual increase in the number of enterprises and manufacturing operations.

name: iowa
sentence: The transition from an agricultural to a mixed economy took place slowly.

name: iowa
sentence: The Great Depression and the Second World War accelerated the transition from small farms to larger farms, and began a trend of urbanization.

name: iowa
sentence: The post-World War II period was marked by a particular increase in manufacturing activities.

name: iowa
sentence: The agricultural crisis of the 1980s caused a major recession in Iowa, causing the poverty that has not been observed since the depression.

name: iowa
sentence: The crisis has led to a significant ten-year population decline.

name: iowa
sentence: After falling apart in the 1980s, the Iowa economy began to become increasingly dependent on agriculture.

name: iowa
sentence: At the beginning of the 21st century, it was characterized by a combination of manufacturing, biotechnology, finance and insurance services, and government services.

name: iowa
sentence: The population of Iowa has grown faster than the United States as a whole, and Iowa now has a predominantly urban population.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Economic Development Authority, established in 2011, has replaced the Iowa Economic Development Department and its annual reports are a source of economic information.

name: iowa
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the Iowa population was 3,155,070 as of July 1, 2019, an increase of 3.57% over the 2010 Census.

name: iowa
sentence: Of the Iowa population, 70.8 per cent were born in Iowa, 23.6 per cent were born in another U.S. state, 0.6 per cent were born in Puerto Rico, the U.S. islands or abroad, and 5 per cent were born abroad.

name: iowa

name: iowa
sentence: In the 19th century, Iowa was one of the first states to enact prohibitions against racial discrimination, particularly in education, but it was slow to achieve full integration in the 20th century.

name: iowa
sentence: In the first decision of the Iowa Supreme Court — in Ralph's Re the Matter in July 1839 — the Court rejected slavery in a decision that found a slave named free Ralph when he walked on the Iowa soil, 26 years before the end of the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: The state abolished racial barriers to marriage in 1851, more than 100 years before the United States Supreme Court prohibited deception laws throughout the country.

name: iowa
sentence: The Supreme Court of Iowa ruled on Clark v. The Board of Directors in 1868, ruling that "separate but equal" schools of a racial nature had no place in Iowa, 85 years before Brown v. Education Board.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1875, a number of additional judicial decisions effectively ended segregation in Iowa schools.

name: iowa
sentence: Social and housing discrimination continued against blacks in state universities until the 1950s.

name: iowa
sentence: The Court heard Coger v. The North Western Union Packet Co. in 1873, ruling against racial discrimination in public institutions 91 years before the Supreme Court of the United States rendered the same decision.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1884, the Iowa Civil Rights Act apparently prohibited discrimination by enterprises: "Everyone in that State has the right to the full and equal enjoyment of accommodation, benefits, facilities and privileges of inns, restaurants, cellars, dining houses, food counters and all other places where refreshments are served, public transportation, hairdressing salons, baths, theatres and all other places of fun".

name: iowa
sentence: However, the courts had chosen to strictly enforce the Act, which had allowed de facto discrimination to be prosecuted.

name: iowa
sentence: Racial discrimination in public enterprises was found illegal only in 1949, when the court ruled in the State of Iowa v. Katz that companies should serve their clients regardless of their race; the case began when Edna Griffin was denied service at a pharmacy in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Civil Rights Act of 1965 codifies all racial civil rights.

name: iowa
sentence: As in the case of racial equality, Iowa was the vanguard of women's rights in the mid-19th century, but did not allow women the right to vote until the 19th amendment to the United States Constitution was ratified in 1920, with Iowa being one of the ratification votes.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1847, Iowa University became the first public university in the United States to admit men and women on an equal footing.

sentence: According to the climate classification of Köppen, the climate of Kansas can be characterized in three types: it has a continental, semi-arid and subtropical wet steppe.

sentence: Kentucky is one of four states in the United States that officially use the term commonwealth.

name: kentucky
sentence: The term was used for Kentucky as it had also been used by Virginia, from where Kentucky was created.

name: kentucky
sentence: The term has no particular meaning in its sense and has been chosen to emphasize the distinction between the status of the royal colonies as a place governed by the general well-being of the population.

name: kentucky
sentence: Kentucky was originally referred to as the "State of Kentucky" in the law that admitted it to the union, as it was called in Kentucky's first constitution.

name: kentucky
sentence: The term commonwealth was used in citizens' petitions filed between 1786 and 1792 for the creation of the State.

name: kentucky
sentence: It was also used in the title of a State history that was published in 1834 and was used in various places in this book with reference to Virginia and Kentucky.

name: kentucky
sentence: The other three states officially known as the "Commonwealths" are Massachusetts, Pennsylvania and Virginia.

name: kentucky
sentence: Puerto Rico and the Northern Mariana Islands are also officially common land.

sentence: The executive branch is headed by the governor, who is both Head of State and Head of Government.

sentence: The Lieutenant Governor may or may not exercise executive authority depending on whether the person is a member of the Governor's Cabinet.

name: kentucky
sentence: According to the current Kentucky Constitution, the Lieutenant Governor assumes the functions of the Governor only if the Governor is unable to do so.

name: kentucky
sentence: (Before 1992, the Lieutenant Governor assumed power when the Governor was out of the state.)

sentence: The Governor and the Lieutenant Governor usually have one ticket (also under a 1992 constitutional amendment) and are elected for a four-year term.

name: kentucky
sentence: The executive branch consists of the following "cabinets", each headed by a secretary who is also a member of the cabinet of the governor:

name: kentucky
sentence: Kentucky's judicial branch is called the Kentucky Court of Justice and includes limited courts of jurisdiction called district courts; general courts of jurisdiction called circuit courts; specialized courts such as the Drug and Family Courts; an intermediate court of appeal, the Kentucky Court of Appeal; and a final court, the Kentucky Supreme Court.
