sentence: Governors are appointed for a term of four years and may request re-election for an additional term (limit of two terms).

name: new_mexico
sentence: Other constitutional officers, all of which also expire in January 2023, include Secretary of State Maggie Toulouse Oliver (D), Attorney General Hector Balderas (D), Auditor of State Brian Colón (D), Commissioner of State for Lands Stephanie Garcia Richard (D), and Treasurer of State Tim Eichenberg (D).

name: new_mexico
sentence: At present, the two chambers of the New Mexico State Assembly have democratic majorities.

name: new_mexico
sentence: There are 26 Democrats and 16 Republicans in the Senate, 47 Democrats and 23 Republicans in the Chamber of Representatives.

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico's Senators are Democrats Martin Heinrich and Ben Ray Luján.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The three members of the United States House of Representatives are Deb Haaland, Yvette Herrell, the Republican, and Teresa Leger Fernandez, the Democrat, who represents the first, second and third districts respectively.

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico has traditionally been considered a turning state, whose population has favoured candidates for the democratic and republican presidency, but it has become more of a democratic bastion since the 2008 presidential election.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The Governor is Michelle Lujan Grisham (D), who succeeded Susana Martinez (R) on January 1, 2019 after being Governor from 2011 to 2019.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Gary Johnson served as governor from 1995 to 2003.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Johnson was a Republican, but in 2012 and 2016, he ran for president of the Libertarian Party.

name: new_mexico
sentence: In previous presidential elections, Al Gore carried the state (by 366 votes) in 2000; George W. Bush won New Mexico's five electoral votes in 2004, and the state's electoral votes were won by Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton in 2008, 2012 and 2016.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Since becoming a state in 1912, New Mexico has been taken by the winner of the national popular vote in every presidential election of the last 104 years, except in 1976, when Gerald Ford won the state of 2%, but lost the national popular vote of 2%.

name: new_mexico
sentence: He also granted his election votes to the candidate who would ultimately win, with the exception of the 1976, 2000 and 2016 elections.

name: new_mexico
sentence: State democrats are generally the strongest in the Santa Fe region, in various areas of the Albuquerque metropolitan area (such as the south-east and central regions, including the tributary neighbourhood of Nob Hill and the vicinity of the University of New Mexico), northern and central-western New Mexico, and most of the Amerindian reserves, particularly the Navajo nation.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Republicans traditionally have their strongholds in the east and south of the state, the Farmington region, Rio Rancho and the newly developed areas of the northwest mesa.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The north-eastern heights of Albuquerque have always looked at the Republicans, but have become a key sector for the Democrats in recent electoral cycles.

name: new_mexico
sentence: While registered democrats are more numerous than Republicans registered by nearly 200,000, New Mexico's voters favored moderate to conservative candidates from both parties at the state and federal levels.

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico abolished its death penalty law, although it did not have it retroactively, as of 1 July 2009.

name: new_mexico
sentence: This means that people on New Mexico death row can still be executed.

name: new_mexico
sentence: On March 18, 2009, Governor Bill Richardson signed the law abolishing the death penalty in New Mexico following the vote in the assembly and the Senate the previous week, becoming the 15th US state to abolish the penalty.

name: new_mexico
sentence: With regard to firearms control, New Mexico may have some of the least restrictive firearms laws in the country.

name: new_mexico
sentence: State law prevents all local firearms control orders.

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico residents may purchase any firearm deemed legal under federal law.

name: new_mexico
sentence: There is no waiting period under state law to pick up a firearm once it is purchased, and there are no restrictions on magazine capacity.

name: new_mexico
sentence: In addition, New Mexico is a "responsible" state for hidden port permits.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Before December 2013, New Mexico's law did not explicitly authorize or prohibit same-sex marriage.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The policy regarding the issuance of marriage permits to same-sex couples has been determined at the county level; that is, some county clerks have issued marriage permits to same-sex couples, while others have not.

name: new_mexico
sentence: In December 2013, the Supreme Court of New Mexico unanimously ordered all county clerks to issue marriage permits to same-sex couples, making New Mexico the 17th state to recognize same-sex marriage across the state.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Due to its relatively small population, combined with many federally funded research institutions, New Mexico had the highest concentration of doctoral students in all states in 2000.

name: new_mexico
sentence: In spite of this, the State regularly ranks close to the basis of surveys on the quality of primary and secondary education.

name: new_mexico
sentence: In a landmark decision, a state judge ruled in 2018 that "New Mexico violates the constitutional rights of students at risk by failing to provide them with sufficient education," and ordered the Governor and the Legislative Assembly to provide an adequate system by April 2019.

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico has a greater concentration of people who do not complete high school or have a college without a diploma than the nation as a whole.

name: new_mexico
sentence: For the State, 23.9% of people over the age of 25 went to college but did not graduate.

name: new_mexico
sentence: This percentage is compared to 21.0% of the country as a whole, as estimated by the American Community Survey of the United States Census Office 2014.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Los Alamos County has the highest percentage of post-secondary graduates from any county in New Mexico, with 38.7% of the population (4,899 people) estimated by the American Community Survey 2010-2014.

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico's Department of Public Education oversees the operation of primary and secondary schools

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico is one of eight states that fund university scholarships through the state lottery.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The state of New Mexico requires that the lottery put 30% of its gross sales into the scholarship fund.The scholarship is available to residents who have graduated from a state high school, and who attend a full-time state university while maintaining a GPA of 2.5 or more.It covered 100% of tuition fees when first enrolled in 1996, decreased to 90% and then dropped to 60% in 2017.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The value increased slightly in 2018, and a new law was enacted to describe the funds available by type of institution.

name: new_mexico
sentence: With an Amerindian population of 134 000 in 1990, New Mexico ranks as an important centre of Amerindian culture.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Both Navajo and Apache share the Athabaskane origin.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The Apaches and some Utes live on federal reserves within the state.

name: new_mexico
sentence: With 16 million acres (6,500,000 ha), mainly in nearby Arizona, the Navajo Nation reserve ranks as the largest in the United States.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Pueblo Indians prehistorically farmed live in pueblos scattered throughout the state.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Almost half of the new Mexicans claim Hispanic origin.

name: new_mexico
sentence: They settled in the northern part of the state.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Most Mexican immigrants reside in the southern part of the State.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Similarly, 10-15% of the population, mainly in the north, can contain Hispanic Jewish ancestry.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Many New Mexicans speak a unique Spanish dialect.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Due to the historical isolation of New Mexico from other speakers of the Spanish language, part of the vocabulary of the new Mexican Spanish is unknown from other Spanish speakers.

name: new_mexico
sentence: It uses many Amerindian words for local features and includes anglicized words that express American concepts and modern inventions.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Albuquerque has the New Mexico Museum of Natural History and Science, the National Hispanic Cultural Center and the National Museum of Nuclear Science & History, and hosts the famous Albuquerque Balloon Festival every autumn.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The first artists of New Mexico whose work survives today are the Mimbres Indians, whose black and white pottery could be confused with modern art, except for the fact that it was produced before 1130 CE.

name: new_mexico
sentence: See Mimbre culture.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Many examples of this work are presented at the Deming Luna Mimbres Museum and at the Western New Mexico University Museum.

name: new_mexico
sentence: A great arts community thrives in Santa Fe and has included people like Bruce Nauman, Richard Tuttle, John Connell and Steina Vasulka.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The capital has several art museums, including the New Mexico Art Museum, the Spanish Colonial Art Museum, the International Folk Art Museum, the Indian Arts and Culture Museum, the Museum of Contemporary Indigenous Arts, the Santa Fe SITE and others.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Colonies for artists and writers flourish, and the small town is full of art galleries.

name: new_mexico
sentence: In August, the city hosts the annual Indian market of Santa Fe, which is the oldest and largest showcase of Indian art in the world.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The performing arts include the famous Santa Fe Opera which presents five operas in the repertoire every July to August, the Santa Fe Chamber Music Festival held every summer, and the Lensic Theatre restored a main venue for many kinds of shows.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Santa Fe also houses Frogville Records, an independent record company.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The weekend following Labour Day boasts the burning of Zozobra, a 15-metre-long puppet, during the Santa Fe Festivals.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Art is also a common theme in Albuquerque, New Mexico's largest city.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The National Hispanic Cultural Center has organized hundreds of performing arts events, art showcases and other events related to Spanish culture in New Mexico and around the world in the Roy E Disney Center for the Performing Arts centre or in other locations of the 53-acre institution.

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico residents and visitors can enjoy art shows from around the world in the Popejoy Hall on the campus of the University of New Mexico.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Popejoy Hall hosts singers, dancers, Broadway shows, other types of acts, and Shakespeare.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Albuquerque also has the unique and memorable KiMo Theater built in 1927 in neo-pueblo architecture.

name: new_mexico
sentence: KiMo features live theatre and concerts, as well as simultaneous films and operas.

name: new_mexico
sentence: In addition to other theatres of general interest, Albuquerque also has the African American Performing Arts Center and Exhibition Hall, which showcases the achievements of people of African descent and the Indian Pueblo Cultural Center, which showcases the cultural heritage of New Mexico's First Nations.

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico is strong for its Spanish legacy.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The ancient Spanish traditions such as zarzuelas and flamenco are popular in New Mexico.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Flamenco dancer and native New Mexican María Benítez founded the Maria Benítez Institute for the Spanish Arts "to present programmes of the highest quality of the rich artistic heritage of Spain, as expressed by music, dance, visual arts and other forms of art".

name: new_mexico
sentence: There is also the Internacional Flamenco Festival of Alburquerque which takes place every year during which Spanish native and new Mexican flamenco dancers perform at the University of New Mexico.

name: new_mexico
sentence: In the middle of the 20th century, there was a prosperous Hispano School of Literature and Scholarships in English and Spanish.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Most notable authors include Angélico Chávez, Nina Otero-Warren, Fabiola Cabeza de Baca, Aurelio Espinosa, Cleofas Jaramillo, Juan Bautista Rael and Aurora Lucero-White Lea.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Similarly, writer D. H. Lawrence lived near Taos in the 1920s at Ranch D. H. Lawrence, where there is a sanctuary containing its ashes.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The strong Spanish, Amerindian and wild West Border motifs of New Mexico have provided equipment to many internationally recognized authors of the State, including Rudolfo Anaya and Tony Hillerman.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Silver City, in the mountains of the southwest of the state, was originally a mining town, and at least a nearby mine is still functioning.

name: new_mexico
sentence: It is perhaps better known today as the home or exhibition centre for a large number of artists, visuals and others.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Another ancient mining town that has become a haven of art is Madrid, New Mexico.

name: new_mexico
sentence: It was brought to national fame as the location of the movie Wild Hogs in 2007.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The city of Las Cruces, in southern New Mexico, has a museum system affiliated with the Smithsonian Institution Affiliations Program.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Las Cruces also offers a variety of cultural and artistic opportunities for residents and visitors.

name: new_mexico
sentence: In addition to the Wild Hogs mentioned above, other movies filmed in New Mexico include Sunshine Cleaning and Vampires.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The different seasons of the A&E/Netflix Longmire series were filmed in several locations in New Mexico, including Las Vegas, Santa Fe, Eagle Nest and Red River.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The widely acclaimed Breaking Bad TV show and its spin-off Better Call Saul were put on and filmed inside and around Albuquerque.

name: new_mexico
sentence: No major professional sports team in the league is based in New Mexico, but the Isotopes Albuquerque is a triple-A baseball subsidiary of the Colorado MLB Rockies Pacific Coast League.

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico hosts several Pecos League baseball teams: Roswell Invaders, Ruidoso Osos, Santa Fe Fuego and White Sands Pupfish.

name: new_mexico
sentence: The Duke City Gladiators of the Indoor Football League (IFL) plays their home matches at Tingley Coliseum in Albuquerque.

name: new_mexico
sentence: New Mexico United, also based in Albuquerque, began playing in the second level of the American soccer pyramid, the USL Championship, in 2019.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Another soccer team from this city, Albuquerque Sol FC, is in fourth place in the USL League Two.

name: new_mexico
sentence: College athletics in New Mexico involves various teams of New Mexico's Lobos and Aggies in many sports.

name: new_mexico
sentence: For many years, both universities had a rivalry often called "Rio Grande Rivalry" or "Battle of I-25" in recognition of the fact that both campuses were located along this highway.

name: new_mexico
sentence: NMSU also has a rivalry with the University of Texas in El Paso which is called "The Battle of I-10".

name: new_mexico
sentence: The winner of the NMSU-UTEP football match receives the Silver Spade Trophy.

name: new_mexico
sentence: Olympic gold medallist Tom Jager, a champion of controversial high-altitude swimming training, led training camps in Albuquerque at 5,312 feet (1,619 m) and Los Alamos at 7,320 feet (2,231 m).

name: new_mexico
sentence: Raton's NRA Whittington Center is the largest and most comprehensive shooting and competitive training centre in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: New York is a state in the northeastern United States of America.

name: new_york
sentence: It was one of the 13 original colonies, forming the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: With a total area of 54,555 square miles (141,300 km2), New York is the 27th largest state.

name: new_york
sentence: Its population of over 19 million from 2019 makes it the fourth most populous.

name: new_york
sentence: Sometimes called New York State, it's the home of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: Two thirds of the population of the state live in the New York metropolitan area.

name: new_york
sentence: With an estimated population of 8.34 million in 2019, New York is the most populated city in the United States and the first gateway to immigration in the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: The metropolitan area of New York City is one of the most populous in the world.

name: new_york
sentence: World City, New York is home to the United Nations Headquarters and has been described as the world's cultural, financial and media capital, as well as the world's most economically powerful city.

name: new_york
sentence: The other four most populated cities in the state are Buffalo, Rochester, Yonkers and Syracuse, while Albany is the capital of the state.

name: new_york
sentence: New York's geography is diverse.

name: new_york
sentence: The state is bordered by New Jersey and Pennsylvania in the south, and Connecticut, Massachusetts and Vermont in the east.

name: new_york
sentence: The state has a maritime border with Rhode Island, east of Long Island, as well as an international border with the Canadian provinces of Quebec to the north and Ontario to the northwest.

name: new_york
sentence: The southern portion of the state is located on the Atlantic Coastal Plain and includes Long Island and several smaller associated islands, as well as the City of New York and the lower Hudson River valley.

name: new_york
sentence: The larger Upstate New York area includes several ranges of larger Appalachian mountains and Adirondack Mountains in the northeast lobe of the state.

name: new_york
sentence: The north-south of the Hudson River Valley and the east-west of the Mohawk River Valley are bisects of these more mountainous areas.

name: new_york
sentence: Western New York is considered to be part of the Great Lakes Region and the boundaries of Lake Ontario, Lake Erie and Niagara Falls.

name: new_york
sentence: The central part of the state is dominated by Finger Lakes, a popular tourist and tourist destination.

name: new_york
sentence: New York was inhabited by tribes of Algonquian and Iroquoian Indians for several hundred years as the first Europeans arrived in New York.

name: new_york
sentence: French settlers and Jesuit missionaries arrived in southern Montreal to trade and proselytize.

name: new_york
sentence: In 1609, the area was visited by Henry Hudson sailing for the Dutch East India Company.

name: new_york
sentence: The Dutch built Fort Nassau in 1614 at the confluence of the Hudson and Mohawk rivers, where the present capital of Albany developed later.

name: new_york
sentence: The Dutch soon moved to New Amsterdam and parts of the Hudson Valley, establishing the multicultural colony of New Netherlands, a trade and immigration centre.

name: new_york
sentence: In 1664 England seized the colony of the Dutch.

name: new_york
sentence: During the American Revolutionary War (1775-1783), a group of settlers from New York Province tried to take control of the British colony and finally succeeded in establishing its independence.

name: new_york
sentence: In the 19th century, the development of the interior by New York, starting with the Erie Canal, gave it incomparable advantages over other parts of the east coast and built its political and cultural ascendant.

name: new_york
sentence: Many landmarks in New York are well known, including four of the top ten tourist attractions in the world in 2013: Times Square, Central Park, Niagara Falls and Grand Central Terminal.

name: new_york
sentence: New York City is the home of the Statue of Liberty.

name: new_york
sentence: In the twenty-first century, New York emerged as the global hub of creativity and entrepreneurship, social tolerance and environmental sustainability.

name: new_york
sentence: New York has approximately 200 colleges and universities, including the State University of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: Several have been ranked among the top 100 countries and countries in the world.

name: new_york
sentence: The tribes of what is now New York were mainly Haudenosaunee and Algonquian.

name: new_york
sentence: Long Island was divided into approximately two parts between Wampanoag and Lenape.

name: new_york
sentence: The Lenape also controlled most of the area surrounding New York Harbor.

name: new_york
sentence: North of Lenape was a third Algonquian nation, the Mohicans.

name: new_york
sentence: To the north of them, from east to west, were three Iroquoian nations: the Mohawks, the Iroquois of origin, and the Petuns.

name: new_york
sentence: To the south of them, divided almost along the Appalachians, were the Susquehannock and the Erie.

name: new_york
sentence: Many of the Wampanoag and Mohican peoples were caught in the War of King Philip, a joint effort of many New England tribes to repel Europeans from their lands.

name: new_york
sentence: After the death of their leader, Chief Philip Metacomet, most of these peoples fled inland, split into Abenaki and Schaghticoke.

name: new_york
sentence: Many Mohicans remained in the area until the 1800s, however, a small group known as Ouabano migrated to the southwest of western Virginia at an earlier time.

name: new_york
sentence: They might have merged with the Shawnee.

name: new_york
sentence: The Mohawk and Susquehannock were the most militaristic.

name: new_york
sentence: In trying to stem trade with Europeans, they targeted other tribes.

name: new_york
sentence: The Mohawks were also known to refuse white colonization on their land and banish any people who had converted to Christianity.

name: new_york
sentence: They were a major threat to the Abenakis and Mohicans, while the Susquehannock briefly conquered the Lenape in the 1600s.

name: new_york
sentence: The most devastating event of the century, however, was the war of the beavers.

name: new_york
sentence: Between 1640 and 1680, the Iroquoian peoples conducted campaigns ranging from modern Michigan to Virginia against the Algonquian and Siwan tribes, as well as between them.

name: new_york
sentence: The goal was to control more land for the trapping of animals, a career that most Aboriginal people had turned to in the hope of trading with whites first.

name: new_york
sentence: This completely changed the ethnography of the area, and most of the big game was hunted before the whites fully exploded the land.

name: new_york
sentence: After that, the Confederacy of the Iroquois offered shelter to refugees from the Muscouten, Erie, Chononton, Tutelo, Saponi and Tuscarora nations.

name: new_york
sentence: In the 1700s, they also merged with the Mohawks during the Franco-Indian war and took to the remaining Susquehannock of Pennsylvania after having been decimated in the war.

name: new_york
sentence: Most of these other groups were mixed until they ceased to exist.

name: new_york
sentence: Then, after the Revolution, a large group split up and returned to Ohio, becoming known as Mingo Senatorca.

name: new_york
sentence: The six tribes of the Iroquois Confederation are currently the Senatorca, Cayuga, Onondaga, Oneida, Tuscarora and Mohawk.

name: new_york
sentence: The Iroquois fought for both sides during the Revolutionary War.

name: new_york
sentence: Today, the Iroquois still live on several reserves in the north of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: Meanwhile, the Lenape established a close relationship with William Penn.

name: new_york
sentence: However, when Penn died, his sons managed to take up much of their land and banish it in Ohio.

name: new_york
sentence: When the U.S. drafted the Indian Expulsion Act, the Lenapes were moved to Missouri, while their cousins, the Mohicans, were sent to Wisconsin.

name: new_york
sentence: In addition, in 1778, the United States relocated the Nanticoke from the Delmarva Peninsula to the former Iroquois lands south of Lake Ontario, although they did not stay for long.

name: new_york
sentence: They mostly chose to migrate to Canada and merge with the Iroquois, although some moved west and merged with the Lenapes.

name: new_york
sentence: In 1524 Giovanni da Verrazzano, an Italian explorer in the service of the French crown, explored the Atlantic coast of North America between the Carolinas and Newfoundland, including the port of New York and the bay of Narragansett.

name: new_york
sentence: On 17 April 1524 Verrazzano entered the bay of New York, passing through the strait now called the Narrows in the northern bay which he named Santa Margherita, in honour of the sister of the king of France.

name: new_york
sentence: Verrazzano described it as "a vast coastline with a deep delta in which each type of boat could pass" and he added: "that it extends inside for a league and opens to form a beautiful lake.

name: new_york
sentence: This vast water table has warmed up with native boats."

name: new_york
sentence: He landed on the end of Manhattan and perhaps on the furthest point of Long Island.

name: new_york
sentence: Verrazzano's stay was interrupted by a storm that pushed him north towards the vineyards of Martha.

name: new_york
sentence: In 1540, French traders from New France built a castle on Castle Island in the current Albany; it was abandoned the following year due to flooding.

name: new_york
sentence: In 1614, the Dutch, under Hendrick Corstiaensen's command, rebuilt the French castle which they called Fort Nassau.

name: new_york
sentence: Fort Nassau is the first Dutch settlement in North America and is located along the Hudson River, also in the current Albany.

name: new_york
sentence: This little fort served as a trading post and warehouse.

name: new_york
sentence: Located on the floodplain of the Hudson River, the rudimentary "strong" was swept away by floods in 1617 and abandoned for good after the construction of Fort Orange, Newfoundland, near 1623.

name: new_york
sentence: Henry Hudson's journey in 1609 marked the beginning of European engagement in the region.

name: new_york
sentence: Sailing for the Dutch East India Company and seeking a passage to Asia, he entered Upper New York Bay on September 11 of the same year.

name: new_york
sentence: His findings encouraged Dutch traders to explore the coast in search of a profitable fur trade with local American Aboriginal tribes.

name: new_york
sentence: In the 17th century, Dutch trading posts were established for the trade of hides from Lenape, Iroquois and other tribes.

name: new_york
sentence: The first of these trading posts was Fort Nassau (1614, near Albany today); Fort Orange (1624, on the Hudson River, just south of the present town of Albany and created to replace Fort Nassau), developing in the Beverwijck settlement (1647), and in what became Albany; Fort Amsterdam (1625, to develop in the city of New Amsterdam which is now New York City); and Esopus (1653, now Kingston).

name: new_york
sentence: The success of Rensselaerswyck (1630), which surrounded Albany and lasted until the mid-19th century, was also a key factor in the early success of the colony.

name: new_york
sentence: The English seized the colony during the Second Anglo-Dutch War and ruled it as the province of New York.

name: new_york
sentence: The city of New York was taken over by the Dutch in 1673 during the third Anglo-Dutch war (1672-1674) and renamed New Orange.

name: new_york
sentence: It was returned to the English under the Westminster Treaty a year later.

name: new_york
sentence: The Sons of Freedom were organized in New York during the 1760s, largely in response to the oppressive Stamp Act passed by the British Parliament in 1765.

name: new_york
sentence: The Stamp Congress met in the city on 19 October of the same year, composed of representatives of all the Thirteen Colonies that paved the way for the Continental Congress to follow.

name: new_york
sentence: The Stamp Act Congress resulted in the Bill of Rights and Grievances, which was the first written expression by American representatives of many of the rights and complaints later expressed in the Declaration of Independence of the United States.

name: new_york
sentence: This included the right to a representative government.

name: new_york
sentence: At the same time, given the close commercial, personal and sentimental ties with Britain, many New Yorkers were loyalists.

name: new_york
sentence: The capture of Fort Ticonderoga provided the gun and powder necessary to force a British withdrawal from the siege of Boston in 1775.

name: new_york
sentence: New York was the only colony not voting for independence, as delegates were not allowed to do so.

name: new_york
sentence: New York subsequently endorsed the Declaration of Independence on 9 July 1776.

name: new_york
sentence: The Constitution of the State of New York was conceived by a convention that met in White Plains on July 10, 1776 and after repeated adjournments and change of location, completed its work in Kingston on Sunday evening, April 20, 1777, when the new constitution drafted by John Jay was adopted with a single dissenting voice.

name: new_york
sentence: It has not been subject to ratification by the people.

name: new_york
sentence: On July 30, 1777, George Clinton was inaugurated as the first governor of New York City in Kingston.

name: new_york
sentence: About one third of the battles of the American Revolutionary War took place in New York; the first major battle (and the largest of the whole war) was the Battle of Long Island, alias.

name: new_york
sentence: Battle of Brooklyn in August 1776.

name: new_york
sentence: After their victory, the British occupied the city of New York, making it their military and political base of operations in North America throughout the conflict and, consequently, the centre of interest of General George Washington's intelligence network.

name: new_york
sentence: On the famous British prison ships in Wallabout Bay, more American fighters died of intentional negligence than were killed in combat in every battle of the combined war.

name: new_york
sentence: Both sides of the fighters lost more soldiers as a result of illness than pure and simple injuries.

name: new_york
sentence: The first of the two great British armies was captured by the Continental Army at the Battle of Saratoga in 1777, a success that influenced France to join the revolutionaries.The state constitution was promulgated in 1777.

name: new_york
sentence: New York became the 11th state to ratify the United States Constitution on July 26, 1788.

name: new_york
sentence: In an attempt to retain sovereignty and remain an independent nation positioned between the new United States and British North America, four of the Iroquois nations fought on the British side; only the Oneidas and their dependents, the Tuscarora, joined the Americans.

name: new_york
sentence: In retaliation for the attacks on the border by the Mohawk forces of Joseph Brant and Loyalist, the Sullivan expedition in 1779 destroyed nearly 50 Iroquois villages, adjacent agricultural lands and winter shops, forcing many refugees to travel to Niagara, under British control.

name: new_york
sentence: As British allies, the Iroquois were forced to leave New York, although they did not participate in the treaty negotiations.

name: new_york
sentence: They settled in Canada after the war and received land concessions from the Crown.

name: new_york
sentence: In the settlement of treaties, the British ceded most Indian lands to the new United States.

name: new_york
sentence: Since New York entered into a treaty with the Iroquois without Congress' approval, some land purchases have since the end of the 20th century been the subject of land claims by the tribes recognized by the federal government.

name: new_york
sentence: New York has sold more than 5 million acres (20,000 km2) of ancient Iroquois territory in the years following the revolutionary war, leading to rapid development in northern New York.

name: new_york
sentence: According to the Treaty of Paris, the last vestige of British authority in the Thirteen former colonies – their troops in New York – disappeared in 1783, which was long celebrated as a day of evacuation.

name: new_york
sentence: The city of New York is the national capital under the statutes of Confederation and the Perpetual Union, the first national government.

name: new_york
sentence: This organization was found to be insufficient, and prominent New Yorker Alexander Hamilton advocated a new government that would include executive power, national courts and the power to impose.

name: new_york
sentence: Hamilton led the Annapolis Convention (1786), which called for the Philadelphia Convention, which drafted the Constitution of the United States, in which he also participated.

name: new_york
sentence: The new government had to be a strong federal government to replace the relatively weak confederation of states.

name: new_york
sentence: Following a lively debate, which included the publication of the now quintessence constitutional interpretation – The Federalist Papers – as a series of episodes in New York's newspapers, New York was the 11th state to ratify the United States Constitution on July 26, 1788.

name: new_york
sentence: New York remained the national capital under the new constitution until 1790 and was the site of the inauguration of President George Washington, the drafting of the United States Bill of Rights and the first session of the United States Supreme Court.

name: new_york
sentence: Hamilton's recovery of the heavily indebted U.S. economy after the war and the creation of a national bank have greatly contributed to New York becoming the financial centre of the new nation.

name: new_york
sentence: Both Dutch and British imported African slaves as workers into the city and colony; New York had the second highest population of slaves after Charleston, South Carolina.

name: new_york
sentence: Slavery was widespread in New York City and some agricultural areas.

name: new_york
sentence: The state passed a law for the gradual abolition of slavery shortly after the revolutionary war, but the last slave in New York was not released until 1827.

name: new_york
sentence: In western New York, transportation was done by expensive cars on muddy roads before the canals opened up rich agricultural land for long distances.

name: new_york
sentence: Governor DeWitt Clinton promoted the Erie Canal, which links New York to the Great Lakes through the Hudson River, the new canal, and rivers and lakes.

name: new_york
sentence: The works began in 1817 and the Erie Canal opened in 1825.

name: new_york
sentence: Package boats pulled by horses on towing routes were moving slowly on the canal, carrying passengers and goods.

name: new_york
sentence: Agricultural products came from the Midwest and finished manufactured goods moved westward.

name: new_york
sentence: It was a wonder of engineering that opened large areas of New York to commerce and colonization.

name: new_york
sentence: It has allowed the port cities of the Great Lakes, such as Buffalo and Rochester, to grow and prosper.

name: new_york
sentence: It also links the emerging agricultural production of the Midwest and shipping on the Great Lakes to New York Harbour.

name: new_york
sentence: Improved transportation has increased population migration to territories west of New York.

sentence: After 1850 the railways largely replaced the canal.

sentence: New York City was a major seaport and had significant trafficking in cotton imports from the South and exports of manufactured goods.

name: new_york
sentence: South cotton factors, planters and bankers visited so often that they had favorite hotels.

sentence: The state has provided more than 370,000 soldiers to the Union's armies.

sentence: More than 53,000 New Yorkers died on duty, about one in seven.

name: new_york
sentence: Since the early 19th century, New York has been the largest port of entry in the United States for legal immigration.

name: new_york
sentence: In the United States, the federal government did not assume direct jurisdiction over immigration until 1890.

name: new_york
sentence: Prior to that date, the issue had been delegated to the various states and then by contract between the states and the federal government.

name: new_york
sentence: Most immigrants to New York would land on busy docks along the Hudson and East Rivers in the eventual Lower Manhattan.

name: new_york
sentence: On May 4, 1847, the Legislative Assembly of New York State created the Council of Immigration Commissioners to regulate immigration.

name: new_york
sentence: The first permanent immigration depot in New York was established in 1855 at Castle Garden, a fort converted from the era of the War of 1812 in what is now Battery Park, at the end of Lower Manhattan.

name: new_york
sentence: The first immigrants to arrive at the new depot were on three vessels that had just been released from quarantine.

name: new_york
sentence: Castle Garden served as a depository for immigrants in New York until its closure on 18 April 1890, when the federal government took control of immigration.

name: new_york
sentence: During this period, more than eight million immigrants came through its doors (two out of three American immigrants).

name: new_york
sentence: When the federal government took control, it established the Immigration Bureau, which chose the three-acre Ellis Island in the New York High Port for an entry depot.

name: new_york
sentence: Already controlled by the federal government, the island had been used as a ammunition depot.

name: new_york
sentence: It was chosen because of its relative isolation with the proximity of New York City and the railway lines of Jersey City, New Jersey, by a short ferry ride.

name: new_york
sentence: While the island was being developed and expanded through land rehabilitation, the federal government operated a temporary depot at the Barge office at the Battery.

name: new_york
sentence: Ellis Island opened its doors on 1 Jan. 1892 and became a central immigration centre until the passage of the National Origins Act in 1924, thereby reducing immigration.

name: new_york
sentence: After that date, the only immigrants to cross are displaced persons or war refugees.

name: new_york
sentence: The island ceased immigration treatment on 12 November 1954, when the last person detained on the island, Norwegian sailor Arne Peterssen, was released.

name: new_york
sentence: He had exceeded his shore leave and left on the 10:15 a.m. ferry to Manhattan to return to his ship.

name: new_york
sentence: Between 1892 and 1954, more than 12 million immigrants crossed Ellis Island.

name: new_york
sentence: More than 100 million Americans across the United States can trace their ancestry with these immigrants.

name: new_york
sentence: Ellis Island was the subject of a long-standing border and jurisdictional dispute between the State of New York and the State of New Jersey, as both claimed.

name: new_york
sentence: The issue was resolved in 1998 by the United States Supreme Court, which ruled that the original island of 3.3 acres (1.3 ha) was the territory of New York State and that the balance of 27.5 acres (11 ha) added after 1834 per landfill was in New Jersey.

name: new_york
sentence: The island was added to the National Park Service in May 1965 by President Lyndon B. Johnson and still belongs to the federal government as part of the Statue of Liberty National Monument.

name: new_york
sentence: Ellis Island was opened to the public as an immigration museum in 1990.

sentence: On September 11, 2001, two of the four hijacked aircraft were boarded in the original World Trade Center Twin Towers in Lower Manhattan and the towers collapsed.

name: new_york
sentence: On October 29 and 30, 2012, Hurricane Sandy caused massive destruction on the shores of the state, ravaging parts of New York City, Long Island and South Westchester with record storm surges, severe flooding and violent winds causing power outages for hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers, resulting in fuel shortages and disruptions to public transit systems.

name: new_york
sentence: The storm and its deep effects led to discussions on the construction of seasides and other coastal barriers around the shores of New York City and Long Island in order to minimize the risks arising from another such occurrence.

name: new_york
sentence: Such a risk is considered highly probable due to global warming and sea-level rise.

name: new_york
sentence: New York covers 54,555 square miles (141,300 km2) and ranks 27th among the largest states in size.

name: new_york
sentence: The highest altitude in New York is Mount Marcy in the Adirondacks, 5,344 feet (1,629 meters) above sea level; while the lowest point in the state is at sea level on the Atlantic Ocean.

sentence: The Adirondack Mountains, with vast wilderness areas, are to the west of the Lake Champlain Valley.

sentence: The large Appalachian Valley dominates eastern New York and houses the Lake Champlain Valley as its northern half and the Hudson Valley as its southern half in the state.

sentence: Much of New York's borders are in the water, as is the case for New York City: four of its five boroughs are located on three islands at the mouth of the Hudson River: Manhattan Island, Staten Island and Long Island, which contains Brooklyn and Queens at its west end.

name: new_york
sentence: The boundaries of the state include a water limit in (hourly from the west) two Great Lakes (Lake Erie and Lake Ontario, which are connected by the Niagara River); the provinces of Ontario and Quebec in Canada, with New York and Ontario sharing the archipelago of the Thousand Islands within the St. Lawrence River, while most of its border with Quebec is on land; it shares Lake Champlain with the State of Vermont, New England; the State of New England of Massachusetts primarily has a land boundary; New York extends to Long Island Sound and the Atlantic Ocean, sharing a water boundary with Rhode Island, while Connecticut has land and maritime boundaries.

sentence: With the exception of areas near New York Harbour and Upper Delaware River, New York has a predominantly land border with two Middle Atlantic states, New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

name: new_york
sentence: In general, New York has a damp continental climate, although in the climate classification of Köppen, New York City has a humid subtropical climate.

name: new_york
sentence: New York's weather is strongly influenced by two continental air masses: a warm and humid southwest and a cold and dry northwest.

name: new_york
sentence: The lower part of New York State, which includes the City of New York, Long Island and the lower parts of the Hudson Valley, has rather warm summers with periods of high humidity and relatively mild cold and humid winters compared to temperatures at Upstate New York due to lower elevations in the region of the descending state, proximity to the Atlantic Ocean and relatively lower latitude.

name: new_york
sentence: At the top of New York, summers are warm, marked by short and occasional intervals of sultric conditions, with long and cold winters.

name: new_york
sentence: The west of New York, particularly the Tug Hill area, receives heavy lake-effect snow, especially during the early winter months, before the surface of Lake Ontario itself is covered with ice.

name: new_york
sentence: The summer climate is cool in the Adirondacks, Catskills, and at higher elevations of the South Tier.

name: new_york
sentence: Buffalo and its metropolitan area are described as climate change paradises for their weather configuration in western New York.

name: new_york
sentence: Summer daytime temperatures vary between the 1970s and 80s (25-28 °C), over most of the state.

name: new_york
sentence: In most winter seasons, temperatures can be expected to be −13°F (−25°C) or lower in the northern (northern) highlands and 5°F (−15°C) or cooler in the southwest and east-central South Tier highlands.

name: new_york
sentence: New York had a record temperature of 108°F (42.2°C) on July 22, 1926.

sentence: Its lowest record winter temperature was -52°F (−46.7°C) in 1979.

name: new_york
sentence: Some of the species found in this state are American ginseng, starred pebbles, waterthymus, water chestnut, eastern poisoned ivy, poisoned sumac, giant seaweed, cow parsnip and common nettle.

sentence: There are more than 20 species of mammals, more than 20 species of birds, some species of amphibians and several reptiles.

sentence: New York's mammal species include the white-footed mouse, the lowest shrew in North America, the small brown bat, the muskrat, the eastern grey squirrel, the eastern cotton tail, the toe, the striped gull, the fisherman, the river otter of North America, the raccoon, the bobcat, the coyote, the red fox, the white-tailed deer, the moose and the black bear of America.

sentence: Some of New York's bird species are collared pheasant, northern bobwhite, ruffed grouse, wild turkey, blue jay, eastern blue bird, American robin and black-headed chichad.
