name: wisconsin
sentence: Winter events include skiing, ice fishing, and snowmobile derbies.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Wisconsin is located on two Great Lakes and has numerous inland lakes of varying size; the state contains 11,188 square miles (28,980 km2) of water, more than any other state, with the exception of three other states, Alaska, Michigan and Florida.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Outdoor activities are popular in Wisconsin, especially hunting and fishing.

name: wisconsin
sentence: One of the most common animals is the white-tailed deer.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Every year in Wisconsin, more than 600,000 deer hunting permits are sold.

name: wisconsin
sentence: In 2008, the Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources predicted that the pre-hunting deer population would be between 1.5 and 1.7 million.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Wisconsin is represented by large league teams in three sports: football, baseball and basketball.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Lambeau Field, located in Green Bay, Wisconsin, is home to the National Football League's Packers Green Bay.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Packers have been part of the NFL since the second season of the league in 1921 and hold the record for the most NFL titles, winning the town of Green Bay the nickname "Titletown USA".

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Packers are the smallest urban franchise in the NFL and the only one held by shareholders throughout the state.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The franchise was founded by "Curly" Lambeau, who played and coached for them.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Green Bay Packers are one of the most successful professional sports franchises in the world and won 13 NFL championships, including the first two games of the AFL-NFL Championship (Super Bowls I and II), Super Bowl XXXI and Super Bowl XLV.

name: wisconsin
sentence: State support for the team is illustrated by a waiting list of 81,000 people for seasonal tickets at Lambeau Field.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Milwaukee Brewers, the only major state baseball team, have played Miller Park in Milwaukee, the successor to Milwaukee County Stadium since 2001.

name: wisconsin
sentence: In 1982, the Brewers won the American League championship, marking their most successful season.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The team moved from the American League to the National League from the 1998 season.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Before the Brewers, Milwaukee had two Major League teams.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The first team, also called the Brewers, played only one season in the new American League in 1901 before moving to Saint-Louis and becoming the Browns, who are now Baltimore's Orioles.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Milwaukee was also home of the Braves franchise when they moved from Boston from 1953 to 1965, winning the World Series in 1957 and the National League in 1958, before moving to Atlanta.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Bucks Milwaukee of the National Basketball Association play home games at the Fiserv Forum.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Bucks won the NBA championship in 1971.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The state also has minor league teams in hockey (Milwaukee Admirals) and baseball (the Wisconsin Timber Rattlers based in Appleton and the Beloit Snappers of the Class A minor leagues).

name: wisconsin
sentence: Wisconsin also houses the Madison Mallards, the Crosse Loggers, the Lakeshore Chinooks, the Claire Express Water, the Dock Spiders Lake Fund, the Green Bay Booyah, the Kenosha Kingfish, the Wisconsin Woodchucks and the Rapids Rafters of the Wisconsin Northwoods League, an all-star college summer league.

name: wisconsin
sentence: In addition to the Packers, Green Bay is also home to an indoor football team, the IFL's Green Bay Blizzard.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The state is home to the 7 times Milsl/MASL Champion Milwaukee Wave.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Wisconsin also offers numerous college sports programs, including the Badgers of Wisconsin, the University of Wisconsin-Madison and the Panthers of the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Former head coach Barry Alvarez of Wisconsin Badgers led the Badgers to three Rose Bowl championships, including consecutive victories in 1999 and 2000.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Badger men's basketball team won the national title in 1941 and made trips to the university four basketball finals in 2000, 2014 and 2015.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Badgers won a double historic championship in 2006 when both men's and women's hockey teams won national titles.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Marquette Golden Eagles of the Big East Conference, the other major college program of the state, is known for its men's basketball team, which, under the leadership of Al McGuire, won the National NCAA Championship in 1977.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The team returned to the four finals in 2003.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Many other schools in the University of Wisconsin system participate in the Wisconsin Inter-College Sport Conference at Division III level.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The conference is one of the most successful in the country, claiming 107 NCAA National Championships in 15 different sports as of March 30, 2015.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Northern Elite Semi-Professional Football League consists of numerous Wisconsin teams.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The league is composed of former professional, college and high school players.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Wisconsin teams include: Green Bay Gladiators, Fox Valley Force in Appleton, Kimberly Storm in Kimberly, Central Wisconsin Spartans in Wausau, Claire Crush Water and Chippewa Valley Predators in Claire Water, and Superior Rage Lake.

sentence: The League also has teams in Michigan and Minnesota.

name: wisconsin

name: wisconsin
sentence: Wisconsin is home to the world's oldest operational circuit.

name: wisconsin

name: wisconsin

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming is a landlocked state in the United States of America.

name: wyoming
sentence: 10th state by region, it is also the least populated and densely populated state of the contiguous United States.

name: wyoming
sentence: It is bordered by Montana to the northwest, South Dakota and Nebraska to the east, Idaho to the west, Utah to the southwest and Colorado to the south.

name: wyoming
sentence: The population of the State was estimated at 578,759 in 2019.

name: wyoming
sentence: The capital of the State and the most populated city is Cheyenne, which had an estimated population of 63,957 in 2018.

name: wyoming
sentence: The western half of Wyoming is primarily covered by the ranges and routes of the Rocky Mountains, while the eastern half of the state is a high-altitude prairie called the High Plains.

name: wyoming
sentence: Almost half of Wyoming's land is owned by the U.S. government, leading Wyoming to rank sixth by region and fifth by proportion of federal government land.

name: wyoming
sentence: Federal lands include two national parks – Grand Teton and Yellowstone – two national recreation areas, two national monuments, several national forests, historic sites, fish hatcheries and wildlife refuges.

name: wyoming
sentence: The first inhabitants of the region include Arapaho, Crow, Lakota and Shoshone.

name: wyoming
sentence: Southwest Wyoming was claimed by the Spanish Empire and then as Mexican territory until it was surrendered to the United States in 1848 at the end of the war between Mexico and America.

name: wyoming
sentence: The region became known as "Wyoming" when a bill was introduced in Congress in 1865 to provide a temporary government for Wyoming territory.

name: wyoming
sentence: The name had been used earlier for the Wyoming Valley in Pennsylvania, and is derived from the word Munsee xwé:wam=nk, which means "to the great flat of the river".

name: wyoming
sentence: The main drivers of Wyoming's economy are tourism and the extraction of minerals such as coal, oil, natural gas and trone.

name: wyoming
sentence: Agricultural products include livestock, hay, sugar beets, grain (wheat and barley) and wool.

name: wyoming
sentence: The climate is semi-arid and continental, drier and windier than the rest of the country, with higher extreme temperatures.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming has been a politically conservative state since the 1950s, with the Republican candidate holding the state in all presidential elections since 1968.

name: wyoming
sentence: One of the most important is Teton County, which obtained the notability of being Wyoming's most democratic county and has not voted for a Republican since 2000.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming's climate is generally semi-arid and continental (Köppen BSk climate classification) and is drier and more windy than most United States with higher extreme temperatures.

name: wyoming
sentence: This is largely due to the topography of the State.

name: wyoming
sentence: Summers in Wyoming are warm with high July temperatures averaged between 85 and 95°F (29 and 35°C) in most of the state.

name: wyoming
sentence: With increasing elevation, however, this average decreases rapidly with locations above 9,000 feet (2,700 m) on average around 70°F (21°C).

name: wyoming
sentence: Summer nights throughout the state are characterized by rapid cooling with even the warmest places on average in the range of 50 to 60 °F (10 to 16 °C) at night.

name: wyoming
sentence: In most of the condition, most precipitation tends to fall in late spring and early summer.

name: wyoming
sentence: Winters are cold, but are variable with periods sometimes extremely cold interspersed between generally mild periods, with chinook winds providing abnormally hot temperatures in some places.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming is a dry condition with much of the land receiving less than 10 inches (250 mm) of precipitation per year.

name: wyoming
sentence: Precipitation depends on altitude with lower areas in the Big Horn Basin of an average of 5 to 8 inches (130 to 200 mm) (which makes the region almost a desert).

name: wyoming
sentence: Lower areas in the North and in the Eastern Plains generally average about 10-12 inches (250-300 mm), making the climate semi-arid.

name: wyoming
sentence: Some mountain regions receive a good amount of precipitation, 20 inches (510 mm) or more, mostly as snow, sometimes 200 inches (510 cm) or more per year.

name: wyoming
sentence: The highest recorded state temperature was 114 °F (46 °C) at Basin on 12 July 1900 and the lowest recorded temperature was -66 °F (−54 °C) at Riverside on 9 February 1933.

name: wyoming
sentence: The number of storm days varies from state to state, with the southeastern plains having the largest number of storm days.

name: wyoming
sentence: Thunderstorm activity in the state was highest in late spring and early summer.

name: wyoming
sentence: The southeastern corner of the State is the most vulnerable part of the tornado.

name: wyoming
sentence: By moving away from this point and to the west, the incidence of tornadoes decreases dramatically with the western part of the state showing little vulnerability.

name: wyoming
sentence: The tornadoes, where they occur, tend to be small and brief, unlike some more easterly tornadoes.

name: wyoming
sentence: As specified in Wyoming Territory Designation Legislation, the boundaries of Wyoming are 41°N and 45°N latitude lines and 104°3'W and 111°3'W (27 and 34 west of the Washington Meridian) — a geodetic quadrangle.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming is one of only three states (the others being Colorado and Utah) with boundaries defined by only "right" lines.

name: wyoming
sentence: Due to the inaccuracy of surveys during the 19th century, Wyoming's legal boundary deviates from the actual latitude and longitude lines up to half a mile (0.8 km) in some places, particularly in the mountainous region along the 45th parallel.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming is bounded to the north by Montana, to the east by South Dakota and Nebraska, to the south by Colorado, to the south-west by Utah, and to the west by Idaho.

name: wyoming
sentence: It is the tenth largest state in the United States in the total area, containing 97,814 square miles (2533,340 km2) and consists of 23 counties.

name: wyoming
sentence: From the north border to the south border, it is 444 km.

name: wyoming
sentence: The Great Plains meet the Rockies in Wyoming.

name: wyoming
sentence: The state is a large plateau broken by many mountain chains.

name: wyoming
sentence: The surface heights range from the top of Gannett Peak in the Wind River Mountain Range at 13,804 feet (4,207 m) to the Belle Fork Valley in the northeast corner of the state at 3,125 feet (952 m).

name: wyoming
sentence: In the northwest, there are the Absaroka, Owl Creek, Gros Ventre, Wind River and Teton sectors.

name: wyoming
sentence: In the north centre are the Big Horn Mountains; in the northeast, the Black Hills; and in the south, the Laramie, Snowy and Sierra Madre sectors.

name: wyoming
sentence: The snow chain in the southern part of the central state is an extension of the Colorado Rockies in both geology and appearance.

name: wyoming
sentence: The range of the Wind River in the western central part of the state is remote and includes more than 40 mountain peaks of more than 13,000 feet (4,000 m) in addition to the top Gannett, the highest peak in the state.

name: wyoming
sentence: The Big Horn Mountains in the northern part of the centre are somewhat isolated from most of the Rocky Mountains.

name: wyoming
sentence: The Teton Range in the northwest extends over 80 km, some of which is included in Grand Teton National Park.

name: wyoming
sentence: The park includes Grand Teton, the second highest peak in the state.

name: wyoming
sentence: Continental division extends north-south through the central part of the state.

sentence: Rivers east of the ditch flow into the Missouri Basin and eventually into the Gulf of Mexico.

name: wyoming
sentence: These include the North Platte, Wind, Big Horn and Yellowstone rivers.

name: wyoming
sentence: The Snake River in northwestern Wyoming eventually flows through the Columbia River and the Pacific Ocean, as does the Green River in the Colorado Basin.

name: wyoming
sentence: The Continental Divide fork in the southern central part of the state in an area known as the Grand Divide Basin where water rushing or flowing into the ocean cannot reach the ocean – everything sinks into the ground and evaporates.

name: wyoming
sentence: Several rivers begin or cross the state, including the Yellowstone River, the Bighorn River, the Green River, and the Snake River.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming has 32 designated islands, the majority of which are located in Jackson Lake and Yellowstone Lake, Yellowstone National Park, in the northwestern part of the state.

name: wyoming
sentence: The Wind River Indian Reserve is shared by the tribes of Shoshone and Northern Amerindian Arapaho in the western central part of the state near Lander.

name: wyoming
sentence: The reservation houses 2,500 Shoshone East and 5,000 Arapaho North.

name: wyoming
sentence: Chief Washakie established the reserve in 1868 after negotiations with the federal government in the Fort Bridger Treaty.

name: wyoming
sentence: However, the Northern Arapaho were forced by the federal government to the Shoshone Reserve in 1876, after the government did not provide a separate promised reserve.

name: wyoming
sentence: Today, the Wind River Indian Reserve is jointly owned, with each tribe having a 50% interest in land, water and other natural resources.

name: wyoming
sentence: The reserve is a sovereign and autonomous land, with two independent governing bodies: the Eastern Shoshone Tribu and the Northern Arapaho Tribu.

name: wyoming
sentence: Until 2014, the Shoshone Business Council and the Northern Arapaho Business Council met as the Joint Business Council to decide on issues that affect both tribes.

name: wyoming
sentence: Six elected members of the council of each tribe shall serve on the Joint Council.

name: wyoming
sentence: Nearly half of Wyoming's land (approximately 30,099,430 acres (121,808.1 km2)) is owned by the federal government; the state still owns 3,864,800 acres (15,640 km2).

name: wyoming
sentence: Most are administered by the Bureau of Land Management and the US Forest Service in many national forests and in a national prairie, not to mention extensive "public" lands and an air base near Cheyenne.

sentence: There are also areas managed by the National Park Service and agencies such as the United States.

name: wyoming

name: wyoming
sentence: Several Amerindian groups originally lived in the region now known as Wyoming.

name: wyoming
sentence: The Crow, Arapaho, Lakota and Shoshone were just some of the first white explorers to meet during their first visit to the region.

name: wyoming
sentence: What is now southwestern Wyoming became part of the Spanish Empire, and later Mexican territory, Alta California, until it was ceded to the United States in 1848 at the end of the Mexican-American War.

name: wyoming
sentence: The French-Canadian trappers of Quebec and Montreal ventured into the area at the end of the 18th century, leaving French toponyms such as Téton and La Ramie.

name: wyoming
sentence: John Colter, a member of the Lewis and Clark Expedition, himself led by French Canadian Toussaint Charbonneau and his young wife Shoshone, Sacagawea, first described the area in 1807.

name: wyoming
sentence: At that time, his reports on the Yellowstone area were considered fictitious.

name: wyoming
sentence: Robert Stuart and a group of five men, returning from Astoria, discovered the Southern Pass in 1812.

name: wyoming
sentence: Later, the Oregon Trail followed this road.

name: wyoming
sentence: In 1850 Jim Bridger located what is now known as Bridger Pass, which the Union Pacific Railroad used in 1868, as did Interstate 80, 90 years later.

name: wyoming
sentence: Bridger also explored Yellowstone and tabled reports on the area, which, like Colter's, were widely regarded at the time as great stories.

name: wyoming
sentence: The area acquired Wyoming's name in 1865, when representative James Mitchell Ashley of Ohio introduced a bill to Congress to provide a "temporary government for Wyoming's territory."

name: wyoming
sentence: The territory was named after the Wyoming Valley in Pennsylvania, famous for Thomas Campbell's 1809 poem Gertrude of Wyoming, based on the Battle of Wyoming in the American Revolutionary War.

name: wyoming
sentence: The name eventually derives from the word Munsee xwé:wam=nk, meaning "to the great river dish".

name: wyoming
sentence: The population of the area continued to grow after the Union Pacific railway reached Cheyenne in 1867, and the federal government created the Wyoming Territory on 25 July 1868.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming lacked significant deposits of gold and silver, unlike the mineral-rich Colorado, and did not experience the growth of the related population of Colorado.

name: wyoming
sentence: However, South Pass City experienced a short-lived boom after the Carissa mine began producing gold in 1867.

name: wyoming
sentence: In addition, copper has been mined in certain areas between the Sierra Madre Mountains and the snowfield near Grand Encampment.

name: wyoming
sentence: Once the government-sponsored expeditions to Yellowstone began, Colter and Bridger's reports, previously believed apocryphal, turned out to be true.

name: wyoming
sentence: This led to the establishment of Yellowstone National Park, which became the first national park in the world in 1872.

name: wyoming
sentence: Nearly all of Yellowstone National Park is located within the northwest border of Wyoming.

name: wyoming
sentence: On December 10, 1869, the Governor of the Territory, John Allen Campbell, extended the right to vote to women, making Wyoming the first territory and, later, the State of the United States, to give women the right to vote.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming has also been a pioneer in welcoming women into politics.

name: wyoming
sentence: Women served for the first time on juries at Wyoming (Laramie, 1870).

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming had the first female bailiff (Mary Atkinson, Laramie, 1870) and the first female justice of the peace in the country (Esther Hobart Morris, South Pass City, 1870).

name: wyoming
sentence: In addition, in 1924 Wyoming became the first state to elect a woman governor, Nellie Tayloe Ross, who took office in January 1925.

name: wyoming
sentence: Because of its history of civil rights, one of Wyoming's state nicknames is "The State of Equality", and the state's official motto is "Equal Rights".

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming's constitution included women's suffrage and a pioneering article on water rights.

name: wyoming
sentence: Congress admitted Wyoming to the Union as the 44th state on 10 July 1890.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming was the scene of the War of 1892 in Johnson County, which broke out between competing groups of cattle breeders.

name: wyoming
sentence: The adoption of the Federal Homestead Act has led to an influx of small-scale farmers.

name: wyoming
sentence: A war of scope broke out when either or both groups chose a violent conflict over commercial competition in the use of public lands.

sentence: The Constitution of Wyoming established three branches of government: executive, legislative and judicial.

sentence: The legislative power of the State consists of a 60-member House of Representatives and a 30-member Senate.

sentence: The Executive is headed by the Governor and includes a Secretary of State, an auditor, a treasurer and a director of public education.

name: wyoming
sentence: The small population of Wyoming guaranteed him only one seat in the House of Representatives of the United States, and thus only three votes in the electoral college.

sentence: The Wyoming State Liquor Association is the only legal distributor of government spirits, making it a state of control over alcoholic beverages.

sentence: With the exception of wine, state legislation prohibits the purchase of alcoholic beverages for resale from any other source.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming's highest court is the Wyoming Supreme Court, with five judges presiding over appeals from lower state courts.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming is unusual as it does not have an intermediate court of appeal, like most states.

name: wyoming
sentence: This is largely due to the population of the State and the reduced workload.

name: wyoming
sentence: The appeals of the District Courts go directly to the Wyoming Supreme Court.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming also has limited state circuit courts (formerly county courts), which deal with certain types of cases, such as civil claims with smaller amounts, criminal offences and criminal prosecution.

name: wyoming
sentence: It is also common for the judges of the travelling courts to hear cases involving small claims.

name: wyoming
sentence: Prior to 1972, Wyoming judges were chosen by popular vote by non-partisan ballot.

name: wyoming
sentence: This earlier system was criticized by the State Bar, which called for the adoption of the Missouri Plan, a system designed to balance the independence of the judiciary with judicial responsibility.

name: wyoming
sentence: In 1972, voters adopted an amendment to Article 5 of the Wyoming Constitution, which contains an amended version of the plan.

name: wyoming
sentence: Since the amendment was adopted, all judges of Wyoming State Courts have been appointed by the Judicial Appointment Commission and appointed by the Governor.

name: wyoming
sentence: They are then subject to a retention vote of the electorate one year after their appointment.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming's political history challenges the easy ranking.

name: wyoming
sentence: The State was the first to grant women the right to vote and elect a woman governor.

sentence: On December 10, 1869, John Allen Campbell, the first governor of Wyoming territory, approved the first law in U.S. history explicitly granting women the right to vote.

name: wyoming

name: wyoming
sentence: On November 5, 1889, voters approved the first constitution in the world that grants women the right to vote.

name: wyoming
sentence: While the state elected prominent democrats to the federal office in the 1960s and 1970s, politics became resolutely more conservative since the 1980s, when the Republican Party came to dominate the delegation of the State Congress.

sentence: Today Wyoming is represented in Washington by his two senators, John Barrasso and Cynthia Lummis, and his only member of the House of Representatives, Liz Cheney.

sentence: The state has not voted for a democrat for the president since 1964, one of only eight times since the state's status.
